name: Thorium Ore
description: Thorium Ore is an ore which generates naturally upon world creation in the Cavern layer, becoming increasingly common further down in the world. It can also be found in Strange Crates and Scarlet Crates. Its associated bar can be made into a variety of useful early game tools and weapons. It can be mined with an Iron Pickaxe or better. The name "Thorium" is inspired by a similarly named teal colored ore in the popular MMORPG World of Warcraft. This ore was in turn inspired by the chemical elemen

name: Patch Werk
description: Patch Werk is a Mini Boss that appears during a Blood Moon. When Patch Werk is defeated, an Abomination with similar stats will spawn instead in subsequent Blood Moons. Defeating Patch Werk is required for the Confused Zombie NPC to spawn. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades, with a rarity of 5. Patch Werk spawns naturally during a Blood Moon. This can happen at any time during the event. Patch Werk cannot be summoned manually using in-game

name: Cook
description: The Cook is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. King Slime has been defeated. If the Cook dies, he will only respawn if the above conditions are met again. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with ceramic plates. The cook can be given specific items to aid in the creation of new recipes. These food items are more powerful than the Cook's basic food and offer more life, buff duration and an added Well Fed. After donati

name: Weapon Master
description: The Weapon Master is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. Coznix, The Fallen Beholder has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with magical demon sickles. Main article: Hired Demon Clicking on the "Hire" dialogue option will hire the Weapon Master for 10 , causing him to grow a pair of wings and become a flying minion, the Hired Demon. The original Weapon Master NPC will still exist, but cannot talk to th

name: Cobbler
description: The Cobbler is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. A player in the world has any type of shoe accessory in their inventory or equipped, with addition of the Aglet and Anklet of the Wind. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself by using a Nail Gun with craftman's nails. The Cobbler can also shine your shoes for free when you select the "Shine Shoes" in the dialogue window. The Shined Shoes buff increases your movement spee

name: Town NPC
description: For a complete list of NPC names, see NPC names. NPCs (Non-Player Characters) added by The Thorium Mod total to 9 Pre-Hardmode NPCs and 1 Hardmode NPC. Primarily, they sell various useful items for progression, such as weapons for early Hardmode (Weapon Master), useful buffs/potions (Cook), or convenience (Druid). Furthermore, some NPCs offer additional features such as in the form of hired help, free movement buffs, or special items provided every half day. Some vanilla NPCs have new items sold

name: Ores and Chunks
description: The Thorium Mod adds 8 new ores to the game, as well as two vanilla ore variants, which generate in the world and are used to craft a variety of tools, weapons, and armor. Thorium Ore, Smooth Coal, Life Quartz, Magma Ore, Aquaite, Mossy Gold Ore, and Mossy Platinum Ore generate naturally, while Lodestone Chunks, Valadium Chunks, and Illumite Chunks generate after certain conditions are met. Spawning Lodestone and Valadium requires defeating Coznix, The Fallen Beholder. Upon his death, there is a

name: Bars and Ingots
description: The Thorium Mod adds 10 new Bars and Ingots. Most of them are obtained by crafting with their respective components at the appropriate crafting stations, with the exception of Sandstone Ingots which are obtained as a drop from The Grand Thunder Bird. Placed bars and ingots act like vanilla placed bars.

name: Confused Zombie
description: The Confused Zombie is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. Patch Werk has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with severed hands. At the beginning of a new night/day cycle, the Confused Zombie will provide one player a random Enemy Repellent, at the cost of 2 . He could provide Bat Repellent, Fish Repellent, Insect Repellent, Skeleton Repellent, or Zombie Repellent. The Confused Zombie can have any of t

name: Abomination
description: The Abomination replaces Patch Werk after you have defeated him. It walks towards the player to deal contact damage. Upon death, it splits into a Grave Limb, Blood Drop, and Severed Legs. It does not drop special loot, and only serves to add variety to the Blood Moon enemies. Abominations spawn during a Blood Moon in Pre-Hardmode or Hardmode if Patch Werk has been defeated in that world. Patch Werk 1.6.5.0: Now also spawns Blood Drops upon death. 1.4.0.0: Now splits into Grave Limbs and Severed

name: Borean Strider
description: "An eight legged menace is prowling the tundra..." The Borean Strider is a surface snow biome Hardmode boss that spawns during Hardmode Blizzards. It drops one of its five weapons when defeated and has its own associated trophy and mask. While The Borean Strider is alive, its exclusive Music will play. The Borean Strider can spawn on its own as long as the player is within a Hardmode Blizzard, but can also be summoned with a Strider's Tear. Its presence is indicated with the message "An eight le

name: Druid
description: The Druid is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. Corpse Bloom has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, she will defend herself with razor sharp leaves. The Druid can be obtained relatively early into a play through and provides plant seeds for purchase. This can alleviate some of the hassle involved in potion creation. The Druid can have any of the following names: 1.6.5.1: Now sells Casual Wolf set and Red Wolf set. 1.6.5.0:

name: Diverman
description: The Diverman is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. The Queen Jellyfish has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with a harpoon gun. Defeating The Queen Jellyfish will immediately spawn the Diverman into the world, wherever the Queen was defeated. The Diverman can have any of the following names: The name "Sam", in conjunction with the Diverman's occupation, is a reference to the creator of the Thorium M

name: Desert Acolyte
description: The Desert Acolyte is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. The Grand Thunder Bird has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with magical wind gusts. Clicking on the "Sandstorm" dialogue option will trigger a Sandstorm event for 1 . The Desert Acolyte sells a variety of items and weapons based around a desert theme. Most notably, he sells items specialized for players using the Thrower class. The Desert Aco

name: Blacksmith
description: The Blacksmith is an NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. The Eye of Cthulhu has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with a molten hammer. The Blacksmith is very helpful for crafting Terrarium Cores, as he sells most Pre-Hardmode ores. The Blacksmith can have any of the following names: The name "Tavernkeep" is a reference to one of the possible names for the Tavernkeep being "Blacksmith". The name "Wayland

name: The Grand Thunder Bird
description: You didn't see any giant bird shadows while you were out in the desert, did you? — The Desert Acolyte The Grand Thunder Bird is the earliest boss available to the player and has the lowest health, defense and damage of all the bosses. Despite this, the player is advised to obtain basic equipment before attempting to defeat the Grand Thunder Bird. While The Grand Thunder Bird is alive, its exclusive Music will play. The Grand Thunder Bird does not spawn on its own, and requires the player to summ

name: The Star Scouter
description: One should take proper precautions before contacting the unknown... — Star Caller The Star Scouter is a difficult Pre-Hardmode boss. It can be considered a biome-specific boss for the Floating Islands, although it will not despawn if taken out of the islands. While The Star Scouter is alive, its exclusive Music will play. The Star Scouter does not spawn on its own, and requires the player to summon it with a Star Caller around Floating Island heights. The Star Scouter flies above the player, lau

name: Scouter Cores
description: The Scouter Cores are a group of three different probes spawned by The Star Scouter in Expert Mode only. Each probe has roughly the same attack pattern involving triple blast attacks and a mini version of the Star Scouter's beam attack. Their attacks inflict various debuffs on hit players, with each core causing a different debuff. The Scouter Cores are only spawned once the player has lowered the life of The Star Scouter to at least 33% life in Expert Mode. 1.5.1.0: Visuals updated. Molten Core

name: The Queen Jellyfish
description: The Queen Jellyfish is a Pre-Hardmode boss that must be fought above the ocean waters. It is considered a biome-specific boss for the Ocean biome. While The Queen Jellyfish is alive, the vanilla track Boss 1 will play. The Queen Jellyfish does not spawn on its own, and requires the player to summon it with a Jellyfish Resonator. It can only be summoned while the player is near the Ocean during the day. The Queen Jellyfish hovers slightly above the player, launching bubbles to attack the player.

name: Thorium Bar
description: Thorium Bars are crafted with 4 Thorium Ore at a Thorium Anvil, and are one of the first tier of crafting materials. In addition to being crafted, they can also be obtained from Scarlet Chests, as well as from Strange Crates and Scarlet Crates. Crafting all Thorium equipment requires 157 Thorium Bars, or a total of 628 Thorium Ore (+ 10 ore to upgrade the Anvil to the Thorium Anvil).

name: Work Benches
description: The Thorium Mod adds 17 new variants of Work Benches. 1.6.5.1: Shady Work Bench sprite updated. 1.6.5.0: Introduced Living Mahogany Work Bench. 1.6.4.0: Introduced Evergreen Work Bench and Gingerbread Work Bench. 1.6.3.13: Introduced Bloodstained Work Bench. 1.6.3.8: Introduced Cursed Work Bench, Naga Work Bench, Shady Work Bench, and Valadium Work Bench. 1.6.2.1: Introduced Ornate Work Bench and Scarlet Work Bench. 1.6.2.0: Introduced Lodestone Work Bench, Permafrost Work Bench, and Plate Work

name: Bookcases
description: The Thorium Mod adds 16 new variants of Bookcases. 1.6.5.1: Shady Bookcase sprite updated. 1.6.5.0: Introduced Living Mahogany Bookcase. 1.6.4.0: Introduced Evergreen Bookcase and Gingerbread Bookcase. 1.6.3.13: Introduced Bloodstained Bookcase. 1.6.3.8: Introduced Cursed Bookcase, Naga Bookcase, Shady Bookcase, and Valadium Bookcase. 1.6.2.1: Introduced Ornate Bookcase and Scarlet Bookcase. 1.6.2.0: Introduced Lodestone Bookcase, Permafrost Bookcase, and Plate Bookcase. 1.4.0.0: Introduced Yew

name: Thorium Anvil
description: The Thorium Anvil is a crafting station which allows you to craft Thorium items, as well as normal Anvil and Work Bench crafting recipes. 1.6.5.0: Now functions as a table for houses and allows items to be placed on top. 1.6.4.0: Added Work Bench functionality.

name: Cactus Fruit
description: Cactus Fruit is a consumable item which buffs the player with immunity to most debuffs. This lasts for 30 seconds, but can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. Cactus Fruit is sold by the Desert Acolyte. It provides immunity to the following debuffs: Cactus Fruit is a useful item that can serve as a partial Ankh Shield, as it provides immunity to a significant number of debuffs. 1.6.5.4: Now also grants immunity to Broken Armor, Feral Bite, Oozed, Liquefied, and Staggered debuffs.

name: Banners
description: A total of 105 Banners have been added to the Thorium Mod, supporting the various enemies added. Not all enemies have banners added. For instance, summoned enemies like Blisters and Bitey Babies, as well as enemies that spawn on the death of other enemies like Festering Sprinters and Clots do not have banners.

name: Thorium Blade
description: The Thorium Blade is a broadsword crafted from 8 Thorium Bars at a Thorium Anvil. Its best modifier is Legendary. 1.6.1.0: Buffed use time from 19 to 18. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Band of Replenishment
description: The Band of Replenishment is an accessory that increases health and mana regeneration and replenishes three health and mana when more than three damage is taken. The Band of Replenishment also reduces the delay before mana starts regenerating. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. 1.5.1.0: Decreased health and mana regeneration bonus. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Crietz
description: Crietz is a craftable accessory. While equipped, any critical strike dealt will create a fountain of 3 sparks of energy, dealing additional damage to any enemy they hit. There is a 3-second cooldown between energy spark bursts. The damaging energy deals a flat 15 damage per spark, and cannot deal critical strikes themselves. The burst of damaging energy will be triggered by mini-crits. 1.6.4.0: Rebalanced to deal a flat 15 damage per spark and have a 3 second cooldown. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. 1

name: Thor's Hammer - Melee
description: Main article: Thor's Hammer Not to be confused with Mjölnir. Thor's Hammer - Melee is a melee weapon that can switch between magic, melee and ranged modes by right-clicking it while in the inventory. In melee form, it acts as a broadsword and has a 10% chance to stun the enemy for 1.5 seconds, preventing them from moving; however, bosses are immune to this effect. The weapon also emits light and particles when swung. Its best modifier is Legendary. 1.5.1.0: Knockback decreased from 6 to 3 and us

name: Mining Charm
description: The Mining Charm is an accessory that increases mining speed. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. 1.6.2.1: Buffed mining speed bonus from 10% to 15%. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Boomerang
description: The Thorium Boomerang is a boomerang that is crafted from 7 Thorium Bars at a Thorium Anvil. It can be thrown a total distance of about 19 tiles before returning. It also has autoswing. 1.6.1.0: Buffed use time from 25 to 15, knockback from 4 to 8, and velocity from 8 to 10. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Bow
description: The Thorium Bow is a bow that is crafted from 7 Thorium Bars at a Thorium Anvil. 1.6.1.0: Buffed use time from 26 to 25, nerfed knockback from 5 to 0, and velocity from 9 to 6.6. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Dagger
description: Thorium Daggers are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that are crafted from 2 Thorium Bars at a Thorium Anvil. They can be thrown a rather far distance. 1.6.1.4: Nerfed knockback from 5 to 4 and velocity from 12 to 10. 1.6.1.0: Buffed use time from 28 to 20, nerfed damage from 18 to 17, and knockback from 7 to 5. 1.6.0.0: Damage increased from 17 to 18, knockback increased from 4 to 7, use time increased from 20 to 28. Is now a throwing weapon. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thor's Hammer
description: Not to be confused with Mjölnir. Each mode in detail: Magic, Melee, Ranged Thor's Hammer is a Pre-Hardmode Thorium weapon that can switch between magic, melee and ranged modes by right-clicking it while in the inventory. It can be crafted once the player has access to Hellstone. Each mode has different attack properties, and caters to the 3 main classes: The magic mode fires a blue wave of damaging Thorium energy The melee mode has a chance to stun the enemy, preventing them from moving The rang

name: Thorium armor
description: Thorium armor is a craftable armor set crafted from Thorium Bars. It takes a total of 36 Thorium Bars to craft a full suit; this translates to 144 Thorium Ore to craft all the necessary bars for this armor. It consists of a Thorium Helmet, Thorium Mail and Thorium Greaves. The Thorium Helmet gives 5 defense and 2% increased critical strike chance; the Thorium Mail gives 7 defense and 2% increased critical strike chance; and the Thorium Greaves gives 5 defense and and 2% increased critical strike

name: Thor's Hammer - Magic
description: Main article: Thor's Hammer Thor's Hammer - Magic is a magic weapon that can switch between magic, melee and ranged modes by right-clicking it while in the inventory. It autoswings, firing a wave of damaging Thorium energy at enemies that can pierce up to 3 enemies. The projectile cannot pass through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thor's Hammer - Ranged
description: Main article: Thor's Hammer Thor's Hammer - Ranged is a ranged weapon that can switch between magic, melee and ranged modes by right-clicking it while in the inventory. Attacking with this weapon throws the hammer in a similar fashion to boomerangs, where the returning projectile chases the player and can pass through blocks. Each hammer can be thrown a total distance of about 28 tiles before returning, and multiple can be thrown out and active at the same time. Its best Modifier is Unreal. 1.2.

name: Thorium Pax
description: The Thorium Pax is a Pre-Hardmode pickaxe and axe combination that is crafted from 12 Thorium Bars at a Thorium Anvil. It can mine blocks up to Demonite Ore. This is a useful item to have early on, as it potentially saves an item slot by combining both functionalities of an axe and pickaxe. 1.6.1.0: Buffed use time from 20 to 18, damage from 6 to 8, pickaxe power from 50 to 60, axe power from 50 to 60, and nerfed tool speed from 13 to 14. 1.5.1.0: Damage decreased from 10 to 6, knockback decreas

name: Thorium Revolver
description: The Thorium Revolver is a gun that is crafted from 7 Thorium Bars at a Thorium Anvil. 1.6.2.1: Sprite updated. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 14 to 12, knockback from 4 to 1, velocity from 9 to 6, and buffed use time from 26 to 24. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Shield
description: The Thorium Shield is an accessory that increases defense by 3 and constantly generates up to 16 life shield. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed maximum life shield from 18 to 16 and life shield generation from 1 per second to 1 per two seconds. 1.6.0.0: Decreased shield generation from twice every second to once every second. 1.5.1.0: Decreased life shield amount from 20 to 18. Life shield now generates constantly. 1.5.0.0: Now gives life shield instead of maximum life. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Spear
description: The Thorium Spear is a spear that is crafted from 8 Thorium Bars at the Thorium Anvil. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 15 to 13 and use time from 27 to 30. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Staff
description: The Thorium Staff is a magic weapon that shoots a magic projectile that splits into 4 smaller projectiles on contact with an enemy or a block. The new projectiles then home in on the closest enemy. Its best Modifier is Mythical. This is a powerful weapon early on, as the projectiles home in on targets. The damage output is twofold when the initial projectile hits a target, and subsequent projectiles hit it as well. The homing projectiles only do 1/4th of the initial projectile's damage. The homi

name: Purify
description: Purify is a craftable tool. It allows the player to purify corrupted and crimson tiles, converting them back to normal, as though they were using Purification Powder. This can be done indefinitely, as it costs mana rather than using the item, and it also has a slightly further range. 1.6.1.4: Renamed from "Spell Book - Purify" to "Purify". 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Renew
description: Renew is a craftable Healer spell that instantly heals the wielder. However, it also briefly inflicts them with the Mortality debuff, reducing their defense, damage and movement speed. Like all healing items, it benefits from any additional healing effects and cannot receive a Modifier. The heal provided by this item is usually not worth the cost during drawn out boss fights or invasions, as the debuff penalties would increase the chance of dying. The heal is however useful at the end of an enco

name: Concentrated Thorium
description: Concentrated Thorium is crafted from a Thorium Bar and an Ectoplasm at a Mythril Anvil, and is used to make high end crafting materials. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Titanic Bar
description: Titanic Bars are crafted with 2 Thorium Bars, Soul of Light and Soul of Night at a Soul Forge, and is a Hardmode crafting material. In addition to being crafted, it can also be obtained from Strange Crates after defeating Plantera. 1.2.12.7: Now much cheaper to craft. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Frost Fire Katana
description: The Frost Fire Katana is a broadsword crafted from 8 Icy Shards at a Work Bench. It has a chance to inflict the Frostburn debuff, dealing rapid damage very briefly. Its best modifier is Legendary. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Firestorm Boots
description: The Firestorm Boots are a Hardmode accessory that combines the effects of Frostspark Boots and Lava Waders, and grants even more movement speed and flight time. Wearing these boots alone will allow the player to reach up to 35 mph while running on the ground. It is crafted at a Tinkerer's Workshop. Because one of each of the Mechanical Bosses souls are needed, this accessory can only be obtained after all three have been defeated. Unlike its components, the Firestorm Boots do not leave a trail w

name: Crash Boots
description: The Crash Boots are an accessory that is sold by the Cobbler after Skeletron has been defeated. It increases movement speed and maximum running speed, and also causes the player to build up momentum and movement speed when running, indicated by a fiery trail that grows larger with more momentum. Running into an enemy will release all stored momentum, causing a fiery burst that damages the enemy and knocks it back far; the more momentum released, the more damage is dealt. Building up momentum doe

name: Traveler's Boots
description: The Traveler's Boots are an accessory that is sold by the Cobbler. It increases movement speed, and also causes the player to reach their top speed more quickly. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Drift Boots
description: The Drift Boots are an accessory that is sold by the Cobbler. It increases movement speed and decreases falling speed, negating fall damage. The effect of Drift Boots will stack with that of the Umbrella, allowing for even longer fall times. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Ocean Bar
description: Ocean Bars are crafted with 1 Coral and 1 Sea Scale at an Iron Anvil or Lead Anvil, and are one of the lowest tier of crafting materials. In addition to being crafted, they can also be obtained from Strange Crates. Although it is the lowest tier crafting material added, it is not the easiest to obtain it's components as it involves going deep into the ocean to retrieve coral, which itself is at the ends of the world, and may prove difficult without means to swim or breathe underwater. It is poss

name: Healthy Boots
description: The Healthy Boots are an accessory that is sold by the Cobbler. It increases movement speed, and also increases life regeneration while running. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Artificer's Rocketeers
description: The Artificer's Rocketeers are a craftable accessory that allows the user to fly similarly to the Rocket Boots, but instead of a set flight time it functions until the player's Artificer's Energy runs out; while in flight, the player has a 50% chance on each in-game frame to reduce their artificer's energy by 1. Additionally the flight increases the player's movement speed by 15%. This accessory is a homage to the original function of the vanilla Rocket Boots which, similarly to this accessory,

name: Sea Scale
description: Sea Scales are a crafting material that drops from certain enemies found in the Ocean biome. It may be difficult to acquire Sea Scales as they require you to travel to the edge of the world and kill ocean enemies, which can be quite dangerous early on in the game. 1.6.5.0: Changed to additionally function as fishing bait. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Arcane Dust
description: Arcane Dust is a crafting material crafted using Fallen Stars. It can also be obtained from Strange Crates. Arcane Dust is a necessary component for many early game Magic items, thus making Fallen Stars a valuable resource for mages. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Sandstone Ingot
description: Sandstone Ingots are a crafting material that drops from The Grand Thunder Bird. 1.5.0.0: Can now be placed. 1.2.5.0: Introduced.

name: Icy Shard
description: Icy Shards are a crafting material that drops from certain enemies in the Snow biome. 1.6.5.0: Now drops in stacks of 1–2 instead of just 1. Sprite updated. 1.2.9.14: Drop rate increased. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Danger Shard
description: Danger Shards are a crafting material that drop from Salamanders, Crawdads and Giant Shellies in the Underground and Cavern layers. 1.2.5.3: Introduced.

name: Petal
description: Petals are a crafting material that drops from Jungle Flowers, Strange Bulbs, and Bloom Mahogany Ents in the Jungle biome. 1.6.2.0: Changed item crafting costs to account for the amount received from Jungle Flowers. 1.6.1.0: Sprite updated. 1.2.5.3: Introduced.

name: Yew Wood
description: Yew Wood is a crafting material and placeable block that drops from Goblin enemies during a Goblin Army event. It can also be harvested by destroying or chopping Yew Trees. 1.6.2.0: Renamed from "Yew-Wood" to "Yew Wood". 1.4.3.2: Sprite updated. 1.4.0.0: Added Yew-Wood Lute and furniture. Can now be placed. 1.2.8.3: Introduced.

name: Unholy Shards
description: Unholy Shards are a crafting material that drops from all enemies during a Blood Moon. Five Unholy Shards can be sacrificed at a Blood Altar to summon the Viscount. 1.5.0.0: Now used at a Blood Altar to summon Viscount. 1.4.3.7: Now used to craft Omen, Dark Contagion, and Whispering Dagger. 1.2.7.0: Introduced.

name: Purified Shards
description: Purified Shards are a crafting material that is crafted using Unholy Shards. Five Purified Shards can be given to the Spiritualist, granting the Guardian Angel buff to the player. Purified Shards are typically the key to getting invested in Thorium's custom Healer class, although Unholy Shards are used more in "dark" equipment. One Blood Moon is typically enough to craft most items requiring Purified Shards. Using a Blood Moon Medallion makes a Blood Moon happen immediately, allowing the player

name: Darksteel Ingot
description: Darksteel Ingots are a crafting material that are crafted using Spikes and Bones. 1.6.5.0: Renamed from "Knight's Alloy" to "Darksteel Ingot". Crafting recipe updated. 1.4.3.0: Sprite updated. 1.2.10.1: Renamed from "Darksteel Alloy" to "Knight's Alloy". 1.2.2.0: Now requires Smooth Coal in its recipe. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Smooth Coal
description: Smooth Coal is a crafting material. It generates naturally in the world upon creation uncommonly in the Underground and Cavern layers. Additionally, it also drops from Earthen Bats and Earthen Golems and can be obtained from Strange Crates and Scarlet Crates. It can be mined with any pickaxe. 1.4.2.0: Now used to make the Vibration Tuner. 1.4.0.4: Placed visuals updated. 1.2.12.1: Placed visuals updated. 1.2.9.4: Torches made with Smooth Coal can now use any kind of wood. 1.2.6.4: Can now be use

name: Magma Ore
description: Magma Ore is an ore which generates naturally in the world upon creation in the Cavern layer, becoming increasingly common further down in the world. It can also be found in Scarlet Crates. It can be mined with a Iron Pickaxe or better. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed required pickaxe power from 55% to 40%. 1.5.1.0: Now requires at least a Gold Pickaxe. 1.2.12.7: Can now be mined with an Iron Pickaxe or better. 1.2.2.0: Now generates in new worlds. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Magma Bar
description: Magma Bars are bars that are crafted with 4 Magma Ore at a Furnace. In addition to being crafted, they can also be obtained from Scarlet Chests and Scarlet Crates. 1.6.0.0: Can now be placed. 1.5.1.0: Renamed from Magma Slab. 1.2.12.7: Now crafted at a regular Furnace. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Granite Energy Core
description: Granite Energy Cores are a crafting material that drop from enemies in the Granite Cave once Skeletron has been defeated. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Bronze Alloy Fragments
description: Bronze Alloy Fragments are a crafting material that drops from enemies in Marble Caves once Skeletron has been defeated. They cannot be dropped from statue-spawned Hoplites. 1.6.3.9: Can no longer be dropped from statue-spawned Hoplites. 1.2.5.8: Introduced.

name: Band
description: Bands are crafting materials used to make basic gem band accessories. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Copper Buckler
description: The Copper Buckler is an accessory that increases defense by 1 and constantly generates up to 8 life shield. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed maximum life shield from 10 to 8 and life shield generation from 1 per second to 1 per two seconds. 1.6.0.0: Decreased shield generation from twice every second to once every second. 1.5.1.0: Life shield now generates constantly. 1.5.0.0: Now gives life shield instead of maximum life. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Tin Buckler

It causes any bullets fired from the gun to inflict the Sundered debuff to hit enemies, decreasing their defense and illuminating them. This does not replace any of the functions the base bullet has. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed velocity from 14 to 10. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 38 to 30. 1.4.3.0: Removed Sundered buff; Lodestone Quick Draw now innately inflicts Sundered on hit enemies. 1.2.3.4: Introduced.

name: Titanium Rifle
description: The Titanium Rifle is a craftable Hardmode gun. It is notable for its higher than usual critical strike chance. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 39 to 37. 1.6.0.0: Increased damage from 38 to 39 and use time from 18 to 20. 1.2.5.0: Introduced.

name: Illumite Blaster
description: The Illumite Blaster is a craftable Hardmode gun. It causes any bullets fired from the gun to inflict the Illuminated debuff on hit enemies, causing them to glow and making them take increased damage from further attacks. This does not replace any of the functions the base bullet has. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed velocity from 15 to 12. 1.2.12.1: Now crafted at a Soul Forge. 1.2.9.4: Introduced.

name: Freeze Ray
description: The Freeze Ray is a Hardmode gun that is dropped by the Borean Strider. It shoots three bullets in quick succession, although it consumes all three. It turns any Musket Balls or Silver Bullets it fires into Frost Beams, which can apply the Freezing debuff upon enemies that significantly decreases their movement speed; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed velocity from 14 to 10. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 46 to 25. 1.2.7.0: Introduced.

name: Adamantite Carbine
description: The Adamantite Carbine is a craftable Hardmode gun. It is notable for its higher than usual critical strike chance. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed velocity from 15 to 13. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 48 to 47 and use time from 26 to 28. 1.6.0.0: Nerfed damage from 68 to 48, use time from 24 to 26, and is now auto-used. 1.2.5.0: Introduced.

name: Terrarium Pulse Rifle
description: The Terrarium Pulse Rifle is a craftable Hardmode gun. It has a 15% chance to not consume ammunition. Its best modifier is Unreal. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed velocity from 20 to 14. 1.4.0.0: Now crafted at Ancient Manipulator. 1.2.10.1: Damage and attack speed reduced. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Omni-Cannon
description: The Omni-Cannon is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. It turns any bullets it fires into energy pulses, which are shot rapidly in rounds of three in quick succession (consuming three bullets) and create small area-of-effect death explosions when hitting a tile or enemy. When fired using right-click, it will instead shoot a single large energy burst projectile (consuming only one bullet) that is shot more slowly, but deals more damage and knockback, creates a larger explosion, and inflicts the Curse

name: Frost Plague Staff
description: The Frost Plague Staff is a Hardmode magic weapon that is dropped by Chilled Spitters and Freezers. Upon use, it releases 5 bolts of magic with the outer most and middle bolts applying the Poisoned debuff to hit enemies, while the other two apply the Freezing debuff that significantly decreases enemy movement speed; however, bosses cannot receive this freezing effect. Its best Modifier is Mythical. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. Buffed projectile damage from 50% to 100%. Nerfed damage from 30 to 24. 1

name: Shade Kusarigama
description: The Shade Kusarigama is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It throws scythes attached by chains that can travel about 29 tiles before returning to the player. They hit and latch onto enemies when returning, stunning them, and will stay latched for 5 seconds before disconnecting. Like most non-consumable throwing weapons, using this weapon builds up an exhaustion meter that appears below the player. Not using the weapon will make the meter slowly go back down.

name: Marine Launcher
description: The Marine Launcher is a Pre-Hardmode Launcher that is sold by the Diverman after defeating Skeletron. It uses Lil' Torpedoes as ammunition, firing rockets that explode upon contact with a tile or enemy and create shrapnel blasts that deal brief additional damage. 1.4.3.2: Sprite updated. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Illumite Barrager
description: The Illumite Barrager is a craftable Hardmode Launcher. Like most launchers, it uses basic Rockets as ammunition, shooting three rockets in quick succession that explode immediately upon enemy or tile contact, although it consumes all three. These rockets inflict the Illuminated debuff on hit enemies, causing them to glow and making them take increased damage from further attacks. 1.2.12.1: Now crafted at a Soul Forge. 1.2.9.4: Introduced.

name: Dread Launcher
description: The Dread Launcher is a craftable Hardmode Launcher. On use, it fires a spread of 4 explosive bombs that explode on contact with a block or enemy. Dealing damage will expel a dread energy particle that surrounds the player for 5 seconds or until it finds a nearby enemy to home in on and damage. Both the bombs and the dread energy inflict the Cursed Inferno debuff on hit. Like most launchers, it uses basic Rockets as ammunition, but the splash damage of the explosive bombs will not harm the user.

name: Terrarium Bomber
description: The Terrarium Bomber is a craftable Hardmode Launcher. Like most launchers, it uses basic Rockets as ammunition, shooting chromatic missiles rapidly in a somewhat inaccurate manner that explode immediately upon enemy or tile contact. These missiles cannot destroy blocks and explode into colorful rainbow bursts, which in addition to dealing area-of-effect damage also inflict the Terrarium Backlash debuff that is characteristic to all Terrarium Weapons. The weapon also has a 25% chance to not cons

name: The Javelin
description: The Javelin is a craftable post-Moon Lord Launcher. Like most launchers, it uses basic Rockets as ammo, shooting missiles that home towards nearby enemies and create large, deathly explosions immediately upon enemy or tile contact. Additionally, it has a 15% chance to not consume rocket ammunition. Its best modifier is Unreal. This item's tooltip is a reference to a quote from the Bhagavad Gita, more commonly associated with J. Robert Oppenheimer, the "father of the atomic bomb": "Now I am becom

name: Spud Bomber
description: The Spud Bomber is a ranged weapon that is sold by the Cook after defeating the Eye of Cthulhu. It uses Spuds as ammunition, launching potatoes that create clouds of damaging splatter upon contact. 1.5.0.0: Updated rarity. 1.4.3.0: Sprite updated. 1.4.1.0: Use time decreased from 29 to 27. Now has auto use. 1.2.4.0: Introduced.

name: Aqua Pelter
description: The Aqua Pelter is a craftable ranged weapon. It does not require ammunition, and instead rapidly launches hydro blasts randomly within a small arc. These blasts do not pierce. Its best Modifier is Unreal. At very close range the DPS of this weapon is comparable to that of the Minishark, though its inaccuracy causes it to fall off rapidly even at moderate range. The projectiles fired by the Aqua Pelter emit a fair bit of blue light as they travel, making it useful for exploring the Aquatic Depth

name: The Zapper
description: The Zapper is a ranged weapon that is dropped by Wind Elementals. It does not require ammunition, and instead shoots a lightning pulse that travels instantaneously and pierces multiple enemies up to a distance of about 34 tiles. Its best modifier is Unreal. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 24 to 23 and use time from 25 to 27. 1.5.0.0: Increased use time from 23 to 25. Decreased damage from 28 to 24. 1.2.8.1: Introduced.

name: Lil' Torpedo
description: Lil' Torpedoes are specialized ammunition that are used by the Marine Launcher. They are not affected by gravity and explode upon contact with a tile or enemy. Upon impact, they create a blast of shrapnel that can briefly deal additional damage to enemies. Lil' Torpedoes are sold by the Diverman after defeating Skeletron, alongside the Marine Launcher. 1.4.3.2: Damage increased from 4 to 5. Changed on impact effect. Sprite updated. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Spud
description: Spuds are a specialized ammunition that are used by the Spud Bomber. They create a splatter when they contact a tile or enemy, which lingers for a moment to deal additional damage to any enemies caught in it. Spuds are sold by the Cook after defeating the Eye of Cthulhu, alongside the Spud Bomber. 1.2.4.0: Introduced.

name: Seething Charge
description: Seething Charges are specialized ammunition that are used by the Hand Cannon. They are heavily affected by gravity and explode upon contact with a tile or two enemies. Upon impact, they create a large, fiery explosion that spreads outwards to cause area-of-effect damage. Seething Charges are dropped by the Flying Dutchman alongside the Hand Cannon. They are also sold by the Pirate. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 30 to 20 and buffed knockback from 5 to 6. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Marine Kelp Seeds
description: Marine Kelp Seeds are a type of Seed that can be obtained from harvesting fully grown Marine Kelp, or as possible loot from Depth Chests. Marine Kelp Seeds can be placed on Mossy Marine Rock or in any Planter Box. Once fully grown, it can be harvested with any tool or weapon to receive Marine Kelp and 1-2 Marine Kelp Seeds. 1.2.10.1: Introduced.

name: Shambler
description: The Shambler is an enemy found within the Dungeon. They walk towards the player to deal contact damage. They have very high knockback resistance. Upon death they drop a weighted ball and chain which latches onto nearby players. The Shackled debuff can be bypassed by pulling yourself away using a grappling hook. The Ball n' Chain grants you immunity to this debuff. 1.5.1.0: Reduced defense from 15 to 10. 1.4.3.5: Now drops a weighted ball and chain on death, which latches onto nearby players. 1.2

name: Darksteel Knight
description: The Darksteel Knight is an uncommon enemy found within the Dungeon. It walks towards the player to deal contact damage and has a chance of inflicting the Bleeding debuff. 1.5.1.0: Increased defense from 14 to 15 and added vanilla loot. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Gelatinous Cube
description: The Gelatinous Cube is an uncommon enemy found within the Dungeon. It slides slowly towards the player in bursts to deal contact damage. It gradually spawns Sludges as it takes damage, which deal contact damage as well but act like typical slimes by hopping. Both the Gelatinous Cube and its Sludges inflict the Liquefied debuff, reducing defense and speed. Like most other slimes, the Gelatinous Cube and Sludge will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel accessory equipped. Gelatinous cu

name: Raging Minotaur
description: The Raging Minotaur is a rare enemy found within the Dungeon. It charges towards the player, with accelerating speed dealing contact damage and inflicting the Staggered debuff, heavily reducing jump height. They can be particularly dangerous in narrow spaces, as they are immune to knockback and the Staggered debuff can make escape difficult. name: Granite-Fused Slime
description: The Granite-Fused Slime is an enemy found in Granite Caves after Skeletron has been defeated. Like typical slimes, it hops towards its target to deal contact damage. In Expert mode, they have a chance to inflict the Granite Surge debuff. Like most other slimes, the Granite-Fused Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel accessory equipped. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.5.1.0: Added immunities and vanilla drop. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Granite Eradicator
description: The Granite Eradicator is an enemy found in Granite Caves after Skeletron has been defeated. It flies quickly towards its target to attack, where the energy link closest to the player will extend and deal contact damage. It can only be damaged by attacking the main body. The energy link can also pass through blocks and deal damage. In Expert Mode, they can inflict the Granite Surge debuff. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.6.1.4: Buffed melee damage from 16 / 32 to 20 / 40. 1.5.1.0: Added immunities an

name: Granite Surger
description: The Granite Surger is an enemy found in Granite Caves after Skeletron has been defeated. It flies quickly towards its target, occasionally shooting homing surge projectiles at them. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.6.1.4: Buffed melee damage from 16 / 32 to 20 / 40, ranged damage from 20 / 40 to 24 / 48, and nerfed life from 120 / 240 to 90 / 180. 1.5.1.0: Added immunities and vanilla drop. 1.2.10.1: Introduced.

name: Crown of Thorns
description: The Crown of Thorns is an enemy found in the Aquatic Depths during Hardmode. It moves slowly along the ground towards the player, leaping over obstacles and dealing contact damage. It cannot swim. It appears similar to a slime but it is not one. It can move without jumping, albeit slowly. Although generally not a threat to a player swimming through the Aquatic Depths, caution should be taken if the player dives close to the floor. The Crown of Thorns deals extreme contact damage and can easily k

name: Marine Kelp
description: Marine Kelp is a type of Herb. It grows in the Aquatic Depths on naturally occuring Mossy Marine Rock, where it can be collected with any weapon or tool. It can also be found in Depth Chests or extractinated from Brackish Clumps. It can be planted on Mossy Marine Rock and Planter Boxes using Marine Kelp Seeds. It does not require water to grow, nor does it die if submerged in water. When fully grown, it will drop more Marine Kelp and 1-2 Marine Kelp Seeds. 1.6.5.0: Tile sprite updated. 1.2.10.1:

name: Sea Ninja-Star
description: Sea Ninja-Stars are consumable throwing weapons that can autofire and are not affected by gravity. They are dropped by Octopuses and Man o' Wars. They will stick to tiles when thrown, damaging whichever enemy contacts them before disappearing. 1.2.10.1: Introduced.

name: Mahogany Ent
description: The Mahogany Ent is an enemy that can be found in the Underground Jungle. It walks towards the player to deal contact damage and can inflict the Poisoned debuff. 1.6.1.0: Mahogany Ent and Bloom Mahogany Ent: Buffed defense from 0 to 8. 1.2.4.0: Introduced.

name: Molten Knife
description: Molten Knives are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that can autofire, can pierce up to 2 enemies and inflict the On Fire! debuff onto hit enemies. They are one of the four throwing weapons needed to craft Light's Anguish or Embowelment, the ultimate pre-hardmode throwing weapons for Corrupt and Crimson worlds, respectively. 1.6.0.0: Sprite updated. Crafting recipe changed. Use time increased from 18 to 22. Debuff duration decreased from 3 seconds to 2 seconds. 1.5.1.0: Fixed being crafted

name: Steel Throwing Axe
description: Steel Throwing Axes are consumable throwing weapons that can pierce up to 2 enemies and are sold by the Blacksmith before the Wall of Flesh is defeated. Like all throwing axes, they have a short range but deal additional damage on their downward arc; throwing straight down will not deal additional damage. The further the cursor is from the user, the farther they will be thrown. 1.5.0.0: Renamed to Steel Throwing Axe and now deals additional damage on downward arc. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Enchanted Barrier Wand
description: The Enchanted Barrier Wand is a craftable summon weapon. It summons an Enchanted Barrier that slowly orbits around the player. On contact with an enemy, it deals damage and inflicts the Paralyzed debuff, but becomes translucent for a second where it cannot damage enemies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. name: Borean Fang Staff
description: The Borean Fang Staff is a Hardmode magic weapon that is dropped by the Borean Strider. It shoots a barrage of five frozen spider teeth projectiles that spread out slowly the farther they travel and can apply the Freezing debuff upon enemies that significantly decreases their movement speed; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. Its best Modifier is Mythical. 1.5.0.0: Decreased damage from 32 to 26 and fang amount from 7 to 5. Increased mana cost from 10 to 12 and use time from 21 to 31. 1

name: Harbinger Blade
description: The Harbinger Blade is a Hardmode broadsword that deals magic damage. When swung, it releases a spread of three magical bolt projectiles, which inflicts the Ichor debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Harbinger Spear
description: The Harbinger Spear is a Hardmode spear that deals magic damage. It shoots an after image projectile which hits and pierces through multiple enemies. Both the spear and the projectile inflict the Ichor debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. Although this weapon is classified as a spear, it will not gain the effects from Spear Tips. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Harbinger Bow
description: The Harbinger Bow is a Hardmode bow that deals magic damage. It does not require ammunition, and instead auto-fires Harbinger Arrows that leave a trail of briefly lingering, damaging energy that inflicts the Ichor debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. Although this weapon is classified as a bow, it will not gain the benefits from the Magic Quiver. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: Spectral Blade
description: The Spectral Blade is a Hardmode broadsword that deals magic damage. Upon striking an enemy, the user receives 20 mana and is granted the Mightily Enchanted buff, which increases magic damage by 15% and magic critical strike chance by 11%, reduces mana cost by 15%, and greatly increases mana regeneration. This weapon is useful to boost spell casting abilities, as the bonuses granted after striking an enemy are all beneficial. However, the downside is that the player would have to approach the en

name: Ancient Light
description: The Ancient Light is a Hardmode magic weapon. It launches three primordial light projectiles that bounce off of tiles infinitely and home towards nearby enemies. Upon contact with an enemy, or after not hitting an enemy for many seconds, it creates a large blue explosion, dealing area-of-effect damage and inflicting the Granite Surge debuff to all enemies caught in the blast, dealing additional damage and lowering defense. This weapon is obtained from the Treasure Bag of the Lunatic Cultist in E

name: Engorged Eye
description: The Engorged Eye is an enemy found on the surface during a Blood Moon. Like a typical Demon Eye, it flies towards the player, bouncing off of tiles that it hits, and dealing contact damage. It also inflicts the Bleeding debuff. 1.6.0.0: Renamed from "Gorged Eye" to "Engorged Eye". 1.5.1.0: Increased defense from 0 to 2 and added vanilla loot. 1.5.0.0: Removed immunities. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Blood Drop
description: The Blood Drop is an enemy spawned by Abomination during a Blood Moon. Like most other slimes, the Blood Drop will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel accessory equipped. Even accounting for vanilla Slimes, they are the lowest health slimes in the game. When compared to Green Slimes, they do 2 more damage and have much higher knockback resistance. 1.6.5.0: Changed spawn origin from Patch Werk to Abomination. Buffed Blood drop rate from 5% to 100% 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Famished Maggot
description: The Famished Maggot is an enemy spawned by Patch Werk during Blood Moons in Expert Mode. 1.6.5.0: Nerfed maximum health from 20 to 15. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed maximum health from 25 to 20. 1.2.7.0: Introduced.

name: Severed Legs
description: The Severed Legs is an enemy spawned by Patch Werk during a Blood Moon. It also spawns upon the death of an Abomination. 1.4.0.0: Now spawn upon the death of Abominations. 1.2.0.0: Introduced.

name: Space Slime
description: The Space Slime is an enemy found in the Meteorite biome. Like typical slimes, it hops towards the player to deal contact damage. Like most other slimes, the Space Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel accessory equipped. 1.5.1.0: Increased defense from 2 to 6. Decreased damage from 28 / 56 to 18 / 36. 1.2.2.0: Introduced.

name: U.F.O.
description: The U.F.O. is a Flying Enemy found in the Meteorite biome. It attempts to fly high above the player while shooting them with purple lasers. The player should use caution when more than one is present, especially in Expert mode. Their ranged attack fires at a very high velocity and deals high damage. Use cover when there are multiple around. 1.6.1.0: Buffed melee damage from 18 / 36 to 20 / 40, ranged damage from 36 / 72 to 40 / 80, and nerfed defense from 6 to 5. description: The Feeding Frenzy is an enemy found in the Aquatic Depths during Hardmode. It swims directly toward the player when they are submerged in water to deal contact damage. Every few seconds, it will spawn smaller, weaker versions of itself to attack the player. If the larger Feeding Frenzy is not killed, the smaller ones will begin to swarm and can overwhelm an unprepared player. It can be considered the Hardmode equivalent of the Sharp Tooth. 1.6.3.11: Sprite updated. 1.5.0.0: Decreased Feeding Fr

description: The Cryo-Fang is a non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It is dropped by the Borean Strider. name: Borean Hopper
description: The Borean Hopper is an enemy spawned by the Borean Strider during its second phase. They will hop at the player and explode upon contact, dealing damage and inflicting the Frostburn debuff. 1.2.12.1: Introduced.

name: Borean Myte
description: The Borean Myte is an enemy spawned by the Borean Strider during its second phase. They will strafe above the player, shooting projectiles downward which explode on impact dealing damage and inflicting the Frostburn and Chilled debuffs. 1.2.12.1: Introduced.

name: Rain Stone
description: The Rain Stone is an item found in Depth Chests within the Aquatic Depths which is used to begin the Rain Event. It can be used at any time, but costs 20 mana. The rain will last 5 minutes on average. If used while there is already rain, it will clear the rain. The appearance and tooltip of this item are based around Aquaius, The Endless Tide, one of the three bosses in The Primordials. 1.6.5.1: Nerfed usetime from 5 to 45. 1.2.11.0: Introduced.

name: Liberation
description: Liberation is a Hardmode Support Staff that can be used to instantly remove nearly all debuffs from an ally under your cursor. If the player successfully dispels a debuff from the ally player, they will receive Liberated, granting them increased base movement speed and brief invulnerability. name: Crystal Honey
description: The Crystal Honey is a Healer accessory that increases maximum life, radiant damage and radiant critical strike chance. 1.2.12.1: Introduced.

name: Blizzard Bat
description: The Blizzard Bat is an enemy found in the Snow Biome during Hardmode Blizzards. Like a typical bat, it flies towards the player and deals contact damage. name: Cleric Emblem
description: The Cleric Emblem is a Hardmode Healer accessory that is dropped by the Wall of Flesh. It increases radiant damage as well as making healing spells heal more life. Bard Emblem Ninja Emblem 1.4.2.0: Can now be used to craft Avenger Emblem. 1.2.12.1: Introduced.

name: Ice Bound Strider Hide
description: The Ice Bound Strider Hide is an accessory which provides increased damage and a chance to receive healing from attacking enemies with the Freezing debuff. This item is obtained from the Treasure Bag of the Borean Strider in Expert Mode only. 1.2.12.1: Introduced.

name: Abyssion, The Forgotten One
description: Abyssion, The Forgotten One is a Hardmode, post-Plantera boss fought in the Aquatic Depths. The boss has multiple forms, each more powerful than the last. While The Forgotten One is alive, its exclusive Music will play. Abyssion does not spawn on its own and requires the player to kill Aquatic Hallucinations in the Aquatic Depths. name: Snowy Owl
description: The Snowy Owl is an enemy found in the Snow biome during Hardmode Blizzards. It flies towards the player, periodically shooting damaging feathers at them. It inflicts the Chilled debuff on direct contact. 1.2.12.1: Introduced.

name: Lost Probe
description: The Lost Probe is an enemy found in the Meteorite biome during Hardmode. It flies above the player while periodically shooting them with purple laser bolts. 1.5.1.0: Decreased life from 150 / 300 to 120 / 240. 1.5.0.0: Increased melee damage from 22 / 44 to 25 / 50 and ranged from 52 / 104 to 60 / 120. 1.2.4.0: Introduced.

name: Astro Beetle
description: The Astro Beetle is an enemy found in the Meteorite biome during Hardmode. name: Hostile Invader
description: The Hostile Invader is an enemy found in the Meteorite biome during Hardmode. description: The Nestling is a Flying Enemy found around Floating Islands. It will fly around, periodically shooting damaging feathers toward the player. 1.5.0.0: Decreased ranged damage from 24 / 48 to 20 / 40. 1.2.6.4: Introduced.

name: Wind Elemental
description: The Wind Elemental is a Flying Enemy found around Floating Islands after the Eater of Worlds or the Brain of Cthulhu has been defeated. name: Army Ant
description: Army Ants are enemies that can be found in the Underground Jungle biome. They crawl towards the player to deal contact damage and can inflict the Poisoned or On Fire! debuffs. description: The Feather Barrier Rod is a craftable radiant weapon. These feathers damage enemies that come into contact with them before dissipating after 10 seconds. The weapon can be cast using right-click to put the feather barrier around the wielder instead, with added auto use. description: The Shadowflame Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode magic weapon. It casts a purple orb projectile that travels relatively slowly, damages and pierces an infinite amount of enemies, and inflicts the Shadowflame debuff. description: The Molecular Stabilizer is a Hardmode Healer spell that is dropped by the Martian Saucer during the Martian Madness event. It fires an instantaneous beam of energy around 35 tiles long that heals allies. description: The Null-Zone Staff is a craftable Hardmode Support Staff that creates a large magical ring at your cursor's position. The ring lasts for 30 seconds before dissipating or shortly after casting a new ring. name: Aqua Potion
description: The Aqua Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Aqua Affinity buff, which increases their mobility in water and lava greatly. The buff lasts for five minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. In addition to being crafted, it can also be found in Depth Chests within the Aquatic Depths as well as the Aquatic Depths Chest. 1.2.4.0: Introduced.

name: Frenzy Potion
description: The Frenzy Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Frenzy buff, which increases all attack speeds by 8%. The buff lasts for three minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. In addition to being crafted, it can also be found in the Aquatic Depths Chest and Strange Crates. 1.6.1.4: Nerfed attack speed increase from 10% to 8%. 1.6.1.0: Now uses Deathweed instead of Waterleaf. 1.5.1.0: Buffed attack speed increase from 8% to 10%.

name: Glowing Potion
description: The Glowing Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Illustrious Energy buff, which increases radiant damage by 10%. The buff lasts for four minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. 1.5.0.0: Decreased radiant damage bonus from 12% to 10%. 1.2.10.1: Introduced.

name: Blood Potion
description: The Blood Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Blood Rush buff, which increases mining and movement speed by 15%. description: The Conflagration Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Conflagrate buff, which burns them over time (similarly to the On Fire! debuff) and reduces their life regeneration by 6, but in compromise increases their damage output by 15%. The buff lasts for thirty seconds and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. In addition to being crafted, it can also be found in the Underworld Chest, as well as Scarlet Chests and Scarlet Crates. 1.

name: Frost-Heart Elixir
description: The Frost-Heart Elixir is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Frost Heart buff, which freezes them in place, making them unable to move or use items (similarly to the Frozen debuff), but in compromise increases their defense by 10 and life regeneration by 40. The buff lasts for eight seconds, but is considered a debuff in that it cannot be canceled manually by the player. In addition to being crafted, it can also be found in the Aquatic Depths Chest. 1.6.3.8: Sprite update

name: Holy Potion

name: Silver Tongue Potion
description: The Silver Tongue Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Silver Tongue buff, which reduces the prices of items sold by NPCs. Note that this effect does not stack with the Discount Card's effect. The buff lasts for one minute and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. In addition to being crafted, it can also be found in the Desert Chest and Strange Crates. 1.6.1.4: Sprite updated.

name: Potent Extract
description: The Potent Extract is a 'buff potion' that, when consumed, provides the player the Hallucination debuff, which makes the player glow in an aesthetic trippy series of colors onscreen. It is sold by the Desert Acolyte. The buff lasts for twenty seconds and, like all debuffs, cannot be canceled manually by the player. name: Explosive Coating
description: The Explosive Coating is a coating that, when consumed, provides the player the Explosive Thrown Weapon imbue, which causes throwing attacks to have a chance to explode upon hitting an enemy, dealing area of effect damage and inflicting the Melting debuff to all caught in the blast for 2 seconds. description: The Deep Freeze Coating is a coating that, when consumed, provides the player the Deep Freeze Thrown Weapon imbue, which causes throwing attacks to have a chance to inflict the Freezing debuff for 2 seconds, greatly reducing the hit enemy's movement speed. The buff lasts for ten minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. 1.2.6.4: Introduced.

name: Gorgan Coating
description: The Gorgan Coating is a coating that, when consumed, provides the player the Gorgan Juice Thrown Weapon imbue, which causes throwing attacks to have a chance to inflict the Petrify debuff for 2 seconds, freezing hit enemies in place; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. description: The Toxic Coating is a coating that, when consumed, provides the player the Toxic Thrown Weapon imbue, which causes throwing attacks to have a chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff for 3 seconds. The buff lasts for ten minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. 1.6.3.8: Sprite updated. 1.2.6.4: Introduced.

description: The Bat Repellent is an enemy repellent that, when consumed, provides the player the Bat Repellent buff, which causes most Bat enemies to become passive, not dealing damage to nor pursuing the player. name: Tidal Wave
description: The Tidal Wave is a craftable, non-consumable post-Moon Lord throwing weapon that can autofire. It throws aquatic shurikens that are not affected by gravity, can pierce an infinite number of enemies and can pass through tiles. Each shuriken travels a short distance before coming to a standstill midair, spinning and releasing wave projectiles rapidly in random directions that travel a fair distance to deal additional damage in a large area; these projectiles can also pass through tiles. Like most

name: Deity's Trefork
description: The Deity's Trefork is a craftable, non-consumable post-Moon Lord throwing weapon that can autofire. It throws aquatic tridents that are not affected by gravity and leave behind small circular patterns of aquatic daggers on hit enemies. These daggers close in on each other, then spread outwards, essentially creating a large field of area damage that persists for about 1.5 seconds before dissipating. name: Lesser Life Water
description: Lesser Life Water is a recovery potion that, upon consumption, restores 75 life and grants the Life Water's Gift buff, increasing health regeneration by 4 and maximum life by 20 for one minute. It is sold by the Spiritualist before Hardmode. description: The Mask of the Crystal Eye is a Hardmode accessory that increases critical strike chance and the amount of damage critical strikes cause. description: The Sorcerer's Mirror is a craftable Hardmode mirror. Once used, it will teleport the player to a random location in the world at the cost of some mana. description: Pot Mimics are a special variant of Mimics that resemble Pots. Just like regular Mimics, they can be found in their corresponding biomes in Hardmode. name: Coin Bag Mimic
description: Coin Bag Mimics are a special variant of Mimics disguised as Coin Stashes which can be found rarely in the Cavern Layer. When approached, they begin to rapidly hop away from the player. It throws pots that can pierce infinitely and drop leaky lava projectiles as they travel, which fall to deal additional damage and inflict the On Fire! debuff. description: The Fishbone is a Hardmode Bard weapon that is always found in the Aquatic Depths Chest within the Dungeon, which must be unlocked with an Aquatic Depths Key. It releases an ancient aquatic blare projectile that ricochets off of tiles and pierces multiple enemies, but loses 25% of its damage each time it pierces. name: Dream Potion
description: The Dream Potion is an unobtainable recovery potion. Upon consumption, it restores 500 life. It cannot be obtained through normal means. As with all recovery potions, it also inflicts Potion Sickness, preventing the use of another recovery potion for 60 seconds. 1.5.0.0: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Edge of Imagination
description: The Edge of Imagination is a craftable post-Moon Lord Bard weapon. It rapidly releases three golden riffs in a spread, which ricochet off tiles and pierce multiple enemies, but lose 20% of their damage each time they pierce an enemy. In addition, the damage dealt by a riff increases by 25% each time it bounces off a tile. When used, it empowers nearby players and the user with the Invincibility Frames III, Life Regeneration III, and Damage Reduction III empowerments. Its best modifier is Fabled.

name: Tile Tester
description: The Tile Tester is an unobtainable block that places down a tile for testing purposes. It cannot be obtained through normal means. The Tile Tester currently places down the Tent ambient object, suggesting it was used for testing items dropping from ambient objects, in this case the Adventurer's Lantern. 1.3.1.5: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Projectile Tester
description: The Projectile Tester is an unobtainable weapon that shoots an experimental projectile. It cannot be obtained through normal means. The Projectile Tester currently only releases blue dust, only damaging enemies when right on top of the source of the projectile. In code, the projectile is listed as "YakaArrowPro", the projectile shot by the Cosmic Dagger, suggesting it was used for testing its projectile. 1.5.0.0: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Holophonor
description: The Holophonor is a craftable post-Moon Lord Bard weapon. It releases a harmonizing sound bolt that homes in on enemies. Right-clicking summons a Mind Rune at the cursor's position that mimics the Holophonor's attacks, firing them towards the cursor. Bringing forth a Mind Rune consumes 5 inspiration and it disappears after 20 seconds. Up to five Mind Runes can exist at a time; summoning a new Mind Rune will replace the oldest one. name: Sousaphone
description: The Sousaphone is a craftable post-Moon Lord Bard weapon. When the attack button is held down, it charges for about a second before releasing a continuous hyper beam slightly above the player that pierces and damages multiple enemies repeatedly. The hyper beam also inflicts the Tuned debuff onto hit enemies, causing them to take extra damage from all damage sources. When used, it empowers nearby players and the user with the Critical Strike Chance III, Attack Speed III, and Damage III empowermen

name: The Set
description: The Set is a craftable post-Moon Lord Bard weapon. It releases a golden shockwave that can travel a considerable distance and passes through tiles. While held, the Percussion Timer will appear below the player; the weapon's effects vary based on whether or not the timer is over a marker when attacking, as well as how long the rhythm has been held. description: The Wormhole Mirror is a tool that can be purchased from the Tracker after completing the "Rune Prune" contract. name: Gold Duck Cage
description: The Gold Duck Cage is a furniture item containing a Gold Duck. 1.6.0.0: Now obtainable. 1.4.0.6: Introduced, but unobtainable.

description: The Abyssal Angler is a Hardmode enemy found rarely in the Aquatic Depths. It swims towards the player whether or not they are submerged in water to deal contact damage and inflict the Feral Bite debuff. It becomes less visible, in a manner similar to stealth, the farther away it is from the player, reaching minimum visibility at about 18 tiles away. description: The Wild Umbra is a craftable Hardmode radiant weapon. When used, the ally with the least amount of health will receive life equivalent to half of the weapon's life cost. name: Decorative Potion
description: The Decorative Potion is a furniture item that is sold by the Wizard. When placed, it will turn into a random potion, which is purely aesthetic but takes the form of a varying real potion from the game. As the displayed potion is random every time it is placed, it can be mined and placed again till it is the desired potion. Strange Decorative Potion 1.5.0.0: Introduced.

name: Bubble Magnet
description: The Bubble Magnet is a unique tool that can be found in Water Chests. While held, all nearby breath-giving bubbles from the Aquatic Depths will gravitate towards the player. In addition, collecting these bubbles while holding the magnet will double the duration of the Refreshing Bubble buff that they grant. 1.5.0.0: Introduced.

name: The Maw
description: The Maw is a craftable Hardmode Bard weapon. It releases a grasping mouth that latches on to its target to do continuous damage while the attack button is held. If the mouth latches onto an enemy and there are other enemies nearby, additional grasping mouths will extend from the initial mouth and latch on to those enemies, damaging them as well. name: Karmic Holder
description: The Karmic Holder is a craftable Hardmode Healer accessory. While equipped, an ancient crucible floats around the player. Every 100 life healed in a heal streak will increase your radiant damage by 8%, which stacks up to 40% at a 500 life heal streak. Each increase lasts 10 seconds and is signified by the ancient crucible changing form. 1.6.5.0: Buffed buff duration from 3 seconds to 10 seconds. 1.6.1.0: Buffed damage increase from 5% to 8% per 100 life stored. 1.6.0.0: Now crafted at a Tinkerer

name: Le Fantôme
description: Le Fantôme is a rare Hardmode enemy that only spawns during a Solar Eclipse. It attacks the player by dealing contact damage, and will teleport around the terrain and sing. Enemies that move near the Le Fantôme while it is singing will receive the Enraged buff, increasing their contact damage. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades, with a rarity of 1. Le Fantôme is a reference to the antagonist in the novel The Phantom of the Opera. name: Goblin Drummer
description: The Goblin Drummer is an enemy found on the Surface during the Goblin Army event. It will walk slowly towards the player before stopping to play its drums when slow enough. Enemies that move near the Goblin Drummer while it is playing will receive the Enraged buff, increasing their contact damage. 1.5.1.2: Increased defense from 0 to 6. Decreased life from 125 / 250 to 120 / 240. 1.5.1.0: Added vanilla loot. 1.5.0.0: Introduced.

name: Goblin Spirit Guide
description: The Goblin Spirit Guide is a Hardmode enemy found on the Surface during the Goblin Army event. It will walk slowly towards the player; when active, all Goblin Army enemies will turn into Goblin Spirits upon death, which turn into Shadowflame Revenants if the Goblin Spirit Guide remains alive for its casting duration. 1.5.0.0: Introduced.

name: Bouncing Flame Potion
description: The Bouncing Flame Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Bouncing Flames buff, which causes the debuffs On Fire!, Frostburn, Shadowflame, Cursed Inferno, Singed, and Melting to spread from the afflicted enemy to nearby enemies. The buff lasts for five minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. 1.6.0.0: Now also spreads the Melting debuff. 1.5.1.1: Duration increased from 3 minutes to 5 minutes. 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Phaseblades
description: Not to be confused with Phasesabers. The Thorium Mod adds 3 new types of Phaseblades to the game to accommodate for the three new gems added. Their stats are identical to their vanilla variants, and they only differ visually. They are crafted with 15 Meteorite Bars and 10 of the given Gem. As with vanilla, Phaseblades can be renewed for Hardmode use by crafting it into a much stronger Phasesaber (see below). Their best modifier is Legendary. 1.5.1.0: Introduced Black, Cyan and Pink variants.

name: Phasesabers
description: Not to be confused with the Pre-Hardmode Phaseblade, which is used to craft the Phasesaber. The Thorium Mod adds 3 new types of Phasesabers to the game to serve as upgrades to the three added Phaseblades. Their stats are identical to their vanilla variants, and they only differ visually. They are crafted with 50 Crystal Shards and the respective Phaseblade, the color determined by the Phaseblade used to craft it. Their best modifier is Legendary. 1.5.1.0: Introduced Black, Cyan and Pink variants

name: Drowned Doubloon
description: The Drowned Doubloon is an accessory that can be obtained rarely from Strange Crates. It allows the wearer to move through water uninhibited and to be considered wet at all times, allowing items that depend on the player being under water, such as Ocean armor and the Hydro Pickaxe, to work outside of water as well. name: Baseball
description: Baseballs are specialized ammunition that are used by the Crude Bat, both bought from the Merchant. The baseballs can only be thrown by using the Crude Bat, and they bounce back after hitting an enemy. Baseballs have a 33.33% (1/3) chance of being recoverable after colliding with a block. 1.6.0.0: Increased damage from 5 to 6. 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Crude Bat
description: The Crude Bat is a non-consumable throwing weapon that can be bought from the Merchant. By right-clicking, the player will throw a baseball into the air, consuming it in the process. Left click swings the weapon like a broadsword; any baseballs hit by the swing will be launched in the direction of the cursor, dealing damage to any enemy hit by them. The baseballs hit by the Crude Bat are affected by gravity. The Crude Bat itself cannot deal any damage, only the launched baseballs can. Baseballs

name: Spirit Breaker
description: The Spirit Breaker is a craftable ranged weapon. Like a Flamethrower, it uses Gel as ammunition, rapidly generating streams of spirit flames that travel only a short distance before dissipating but hit and pierce multiple times through enemies, inflict the Frostburn debuff, and heal the player for 2 health upon dealing a critical strike. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, the Spirit Breaker will have a rarity of instead of the standard . 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Steamgunner Controller
description: The Steamgunner Controller is a Hardmode summon weapon purchased from the Steampunker for 50 . It spawns a Steamgunner Drone to rapidly fire bullets at nearby enemies. Like other minions, summoned Steamgunner Drones are invincible and follow the player for an unlimited amount of time, unless the player dies, summons a replacement minion, or cancels the buff. description: The Whirlpool is a Hardmode yoyo that is purchased from the Diverman after defeating Abyssion, The Forgotten One. It has a reach of about 22 tiles and a 30 second attack duration. This yoyo has the unique ability to draw in enemies within 6 blocks of the yoyo disk. name: Heart Wand
description: The Heart Wand is a craftable Healer spell. On use, a heart will drop from the caster's head every half-second, which will heal the caster or their allies when touched. The user will lose mana each time a new heart is produced, and the hearts will linger for a minute before disappearing or if more than 10 hearts are produced. Like all healing items, it benefits from any additional healing effects and cannot receive a Modifier. 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Magma-bound Fishing Line
description: The Magma-bound Fishing Line is an accessory that can be obtained from Scarlet Chests. It allows the player to fish in Lava with any Fishing Pole when equipped. Unlike other Scarlet Chest items, the Magma-bound Fishing Line cannot be obtained from opening Scarlet Crates. name: Honeysuckle
description: The Honeysuckle is a craftable Healer spell. It shoots streams of honey that can heal up to two allies and cover them in honey. Like all healing items, it benefits from any additional healing effects and cannot receive a Modifier. 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Recuperate
description: The Recuperate is a Hardmode Healer spell sold by the Spiritualist after defeating Coznix, The Fallen Beholder. While channeled, the wielder will recover life at the cost of mana. The heal rate and mana cost increases depending on the Bonus Healing the wielder has. Like all healing items, it cannot receive a Modifier. The tome will not be usable while the player is at maximum health. While the tome will work when the player has no Bonus Healing, it will not drain any mana nor heal any life. 1.5.

description: Inspiration Hair Dye is a consumable item sold by the Stylist NPC if the player has 20 or higher maximum inspiration. When used, it causes the player's hair color to change depending on the amount of inspiration the player currently has. 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Aggro Dummy
description: The Aggro Dummy is an enemy which servers a purpose of an enhanced Target Dummy. Contrary to Target Dummy, it fully counts as an enemy so homing projectiles will home in on it and healing effects like life drain will be triggered. It cannot spawn naturally. DPS Meter, an accessory showing wearer's damage per second, useful for testing damage on Aggro Dummies

name: Unassuming Blue Stone
description: The Unassuming Blue Stone is an unobtainable tool that instantly teleports the user to the cursor's location on use, like the Rod of Discord, though without the penalty. Additionally, right-clicking will scroll the viewing area in the direction of the cursor much like the Sniper Scope, effectively increasing the range of the teleport. It cannot be obtained through normal means. While the Unassuming Blue Stone is held, a dull light will follow the player's cursor, illuminating the area around it.

name: Unassuming Green Stone
description: The Unassuming Green Stone is an unobtainable tool that slows down all enemies and hostile projectiles within its range. It cannot be obtained through normal means. 1.5.1.0: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Unassuming Yellow Stone
description: The Unassuming Yellow Stone is an unobtainable tool that confuses all enemies and makes Town NPCs drop a random amount of coins. Additionally, item prices will be discounted while held. It cannot be obtained through normal means. 1.5.1.0: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Unassuming Orange Stone
description: The Unassuming Orange Stone is an unobtainable tool that, on use, creates a glowing orange soul at the player's position. Right-clicking with the stone while the player's soul is anchored will teleport them back to the soul's position, reverting their health and mana back to when the left-click was used. It cannot be obtained through normal means. 1.5.1.0: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Unassuming Red Stone
description: The Unassuming Red Stone is an unobtainable tool that transforms all enemies into bubbles, instantly defeating them but not dropping any of their possible items. It cannot be obtained through normal means. 1.5.1.0: Introduced, but unobtainable.

name: Cactus Needle
description: Cactus Needles are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that stick into enemies for 3 seconds, poisoning them. Only one needle can be stuck in an enemy at a time. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Icy Tomahawk
description: Icy Tomahawks are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that can autofire. They decelerate quickly before coming to a stop and disappearing, but are not affected by gravity and can pierce up to 2 enemies. They have a chance to inflict the Frostburn debuff onto hit enemies, dealing damage over time. 1.6.5.1: Converted to a tomahawk. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Iron Tomahawk
description: Iron Tomahawks are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that can autofire. They decelerate quickly before coming to a stop and disappearing, but are not affected by gravity and can pierce up to 2 enemies. Its ore counterpart is the Lead Tomahawk. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Lead Tomahawk
