name: Shinobi Slicer
description: Shinobi Slicers are consumable throwing weapons that can pierce up to 2 enemies. They are dropped by the King Slime, and can also be crafted after its defeat. They tend to accelerate downwards and bounce off of tiles up to 3 times, dissipating upon the fourth tile contact or after about 3.5 seconds. The velocity of the slicers is preserved when bouncing, meaning that the higher their velocity is upon landing, the faster and further they will go afterwards. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Enchanted Knife
description: Enchanted Knives are consumable throwing weapons that can pierce up to 4 enemies. They can be found in Underground Gold Chests, as well as in Iron and Golden Crates from fishing. They are notable for having a very wide arc, and thus are capable of traveling a long distance. They also have a higher than average chance to become retrievable after breaking against an enemy or tile. description: Demonite Tomahawks are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that can autofire. They decelerate quickly before coming to a stop and disappearing, but are not affected by gravity and can pierce up to 2 enemies. They are one of the four throwing weapons needed to craft Light's Anguish, the ultimate pre-hardmode throwing weapon for Corrupt worlds. These cluster blasts inflict the Singed debuff onto hit enemies, although the initial bomb's impact does not. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

description: Harpy's Barrages are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that can autofire. name: Arcane Anelace
description: Arcane Anelaces are consumable throwing weapons that are obtained from the Dark Mage's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode. Aside from having a considerable range, they are notable for having a 100% chance to become retrievable after breaking against an enemy or tile. However, they also have a much lesser maximum stack size than other consumable throwing weapons. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Bolas
description: Bolas are craftable, consumable throwing weapons that can autofire. They can also be found in Rich Mahogany Chests and Ivy Chests within the Underground Jungle. They are not affected by gravity and travel a long distance before dissipating. They also ensnare hit enemies, sticking to them and stunning them to prevent them from moving; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. 1.6.1.0: Added crafting recipe. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Wack Wrench
description: Wack Wrenches are consumable throwing weapons that are sold by the Mechanic. They travel slowly and are not affected by gravity, piercing multiple enemies and often striking each multiple times. They dissipate after traveling a long distance or after having struck enemies 10 times. This weapon is a reference to the Rocky Wrench enemies from the Super Mario series. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Spiky Caltrop

name: Naiad's Shiv

The name "Halcandran" refers to Magolor's home world of Halcandra. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Festering Balloon
description: Festering Balloons are craftable, consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire. They drift upwards slightly and linger in the air, and are initially harmless. However, the user can right-click with the weapon to throw a weak dart, which deals minimal damage, pierces infinitely, and does not consume any additional balloons, as well as popping any thrown balloons that it contacts. Upon popping, the balloon will release 6 ichor droplets that shower the area below and linger on the ground

name: Crystal Balloon
description: Crystal Balloons are craftable, consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire. They drift upwards slightly and linger in the air, and are initially harmless. However, the user can right-click with the weapon to throw a weak dart, which deals minimal damage, pierces infinitely, and does not consume any additional balloons, as well as popping any thrown balloons that it contacts. Upon popping, the balloon will release six crystal sparks that shower the area below and linger on the ground

name: Blank Technique Scroll
description: The Blank Technique Scroll is a crafting material that is sold by the Desert Acolyte. It is used to craft different Technique Scrolls. 1.6.0.3: Sprite updated. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Shadow-Tipped Javelin
description: Shadow-Tipped Javelins are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire. They are dropped by the Goblin Summoner during the Goblin Army event. They stick into enemies for 10 seconds, and up to two javelins can be stuck in an enemy at a time. Every third javelin stuck in the same enemy will remove the last and release an area-of-effect shadowy burst that inflicts all enemies it contacts with the Shadowflame debuff. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Shadow-Purge Caltrop
description: Shadow-Purge Caltrops are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that have a short range, but linger on the ground for 20 seconds after being thrown. They drop from certain Goblin enemies during the Goblin Army event after the Wall of Flesh has been defeated. Upon contacting an enemy, they burst into 4-5 shadowy tendrils that shower the surrounding area, damaging enemies. Both the initial hit and the shadowy tendrils inflict the Shadowflame debuff. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Swamp Rot
description: The Swamp Rot is a non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It is dropped by Swamp Things during the Solar Eclipse event. It throws swampy javelins that stick into enemies for 10 seconds, dealing additional damage over time at a slow 10 damage per second. This can stack with successive stuck javelins in the same enemy, up to 50 damage per second. Up to five javelins can be stuck in all enemies in total at a time. Like most non-consumable throwing weapons, using this weapon buil

name: Captain's Poignard
description: Captain's Poignards are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire, arc downwards after a small distance, and can pierce up to 4 enemies. They are dropped by Pirate Captains during the Pirate Invasion event, and are also sold by the Pirate. If a poignard strikes an enemy within about 8 tiles from the user, they will be granted the Burst of Speed buff, increasing their throwing speed. 1.6.1.0: Nerfed damage from 38 to 31. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Carnwennan
description: The Carnwennan is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. Each use throws a volley of three daggers in a fan that arc downwards after a considerable distance, starting a sharp descent downward after approximately 22 blocks. Like most non-consumable throwing weapons, using this weapon builds up an exhaustion meter that appears below the player. Not using the weapon will make the meter slowly go back down. However, if it becomes completely filled, the user will be i

name: True Embowelment
description: The True Embowelment is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It throws crimson daggers that are not affected by gravity and steal 3 life upon hitting enemies. Additionally, hitting enemies causes the user to unleash a barrage of blood tendrils that seek out the hit target to deal additional damage. Like most non-consumable throwing weapons, using this weapon builds up an exhaustion meter that appears below the player. Not using the weapon will make the meter sl

name: True Light's Anguish
description: The True Light's Anguish is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It throws corrupted daggers that are not affected by gravity and inflict the Light Curse and Cursed Inferno debuffs onto hit enemies. Additionally, hitting enemies causes the user to unleash a barrage of cursed tendrils that seek out the hit target to deal additional damage. Like most non-consumable throwing weapons, using this weapon builds up an exhaustion meter that appears below the player. No

name: True Carnwennan
description: The True Carnwennan is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. Each use throws a volley of five daggers that arc downwards after a considerable distance. The two outer daggers are enchanted and can pierce an infinite number of enemies. Like most non-consumable throwing weapons, using this weapon builds up an exhaustion meter that appears below the player. Not using the weapon will make the meter slowly go back down. However, if it becomes completely filled, the us

name: Terra Knife
description: The Terra Knife is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It rapidly throws terra daggers that are not affected by gravity. Right-clicking with the weapon will instead throw an impaling knife, which sticks into the hit enemy for 10 seconds; while the knife is stuck, the user will constantly unleash terra energy tendrils that seek out the impaling knife's target to deal additional damage. Only one impaling knife can be stuck in an enemy at a time. Like most non-co

name: Tracker's Board
description: The Tracker's Board is a furniture item that, when placed and right-clicked, opens up the Tracker's Contract UI. It is sold by the Tracker for 5 at any point and does not require a specific contract to be completed. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Icy Gaze
description: The Icy Gaze is a unique Hardmode true damage weapon that can be bought from the Tracker after completing the "Ice Breaker" contract. It shoots a large, infinite pierce, icy laser beam that inflicts the Freezing debuff, slowing down enemy movement speed significantly; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. Note that it has no specific class, as it deals true damage rather than melee, ranged, magic, summon, throwing, radiant, or symphonic damage. This also means that its damage value is not

name: Stalker's Snippers
description: The Stalker's Snippers are a non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It is dropped by Scissor Stalkers during the Solar Eclipse event. It throws scissors that can stick into an enemy for up to 2 seconds; only one enemy can have scissors stuck in it at a time, but up to three scissors can be stuck in that enemy. Upon hitting an enemy with four scissors already stuck in it, the scissors will disappear in a bloody burst that inflicts the enemy with the Gouge debuff. Like most non

name: Playing Card
description: Playing Cards are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire. They are sold by the Party Girl after all Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. They are not affected by gravity and have four different appearances, based on the four suits. Thrown cards have a chance to instead be pink cards that fly faster and create a small area-of-effect explosion upon tile or enemy impact. 1.6.0.3: Decreased damage from 53 to 49 and increased exploding projectile damage from 125% to 150%. 1.6.0.0: In

name: Chlorophyte Tomahawk
description: Chlorophyte Tomahawks are craftable, consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire. They decelerate quickly before coming to a stop and disappearing, but are not affected by gravity and can pierce up to 4 enemies, as well as poisoning them. 1.6.0.1: Now crafted at a Mythril or Orichalcum Anvil. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Bud Bomb
description: Bud Bombs are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire and pierce an infinite number of enemies. They are dropped by Plantera, and are also sold by the Druid upon Plantera's defeat. They sprout into repelling flowers upon contacting a tile, which grow upwards from the impact point and damage and knock back enemies that contact them as well as inflicting the Venom debuff. The flower reaches a height of about 9 tiles at full growth and lingers for about 4 seconds before disappearing.

name: Proximity Mine
description: Proximity Mines are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that have a short range, but linger on the ground for 20 seconds after being thrown. They drop from Skeleton Snipers, Tactical Skeletons, and Skeleton Commandos. Upon contacting an enemy, they burst into an area-of-effect explosion that damages enemies and inflicts them with the Singed debuff. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Electro-Rebounder
description: Electro-Rebounders are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire, are not affected by gravity, and can pierce up to 9 enemies. They are dropped by Martian Walkers during the Martian Madness event. They travel a short distance in the thrown direction before accelerating in the opposite direction for a considerable distance, and can pass through tiles during this rebound. They have a chance to inflict the Paralyzed debuff onto hit enemies, briefly disabling their movement; however, bo

name: Guild's Staff
description: The Guild's Staff is a Pet summoning item that is dropped by Skeletron. It spawns a Lil' Necromancer to follow you around. The Lil' Necromancer is immune to damage from enemies and despawns upon player death. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, the Guild's Staff will have a rarity of instead of the standard . This item and the pet itself are a reference to the Overlord light novel series, in which the main character, Ainz Ooal Gown, is a necromancer with a similar ap

name: White Dwarf Fragment
description: White Dwarf Fragments are a crafting material that drops from the Celestial Towers. It is used to make end-game Thrower items. Crafting all of the White Dwarf items requires 113 White Dwarf Fragments and 68 Luminite Bars (272 Luminite). 1.6.4.0: Now craftable from other Thorium Lunar Fragments. 1.6.2.0: Tooltip updated. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Dragon Fang
description: The Dragon Fang is a non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It is dropped by Betsy during the Old One's Army event. It throws fangs that arc downwards after a considerable distance. Upon hitting an enemy, the fang bursts into a cone-shaped spread of five spinning dragon fire projectiles that continue to travel in the original direction. The fire projectiles damage and pierce through an infinite number of enemies and inflict them with the Melting debuff before dissipating afte

name: Witchblade
description: The Witchblade is a non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It is dropped by Pumpkings during the Pumpkin Moon event. It throws blades that arc downwards after a considerable distance and can pierce up to 2 enemies. Right-clicking with the weapon allows the user to perform a horizontal dash forward, charging through enemies; the dash does not inflict any damage, but gives the user a few frames of invincibility. It also has a higher than usual critical strike chance. Like most

name: Soft Serve Sunderer
description: Soft Serve Sunderers are consumable Hardmode throwing weapons that can autofire. They are dropped by Ice Queens during the Frost Moon event. They have four different appearances based on different ice cream cone flavors. They stick into enemies for 10 seconds, and up to four cones can be stuck in an enemy at a time. Upon hitting an enemy with four cones already stuck in it, the cones will disappear in a burst that permanently decreases the defense of that enemy. Additionally, they have a 15% cha

name: Star Eater
description: The Star Eater is a craftable, non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It rapidly throws "sleeping giants" that fly extremely fast and are not affected by gravity. They stick into enemies for 10 seconds, and up to 10 sleeping giants can be stuck in an enemy at a time. Each sleeping giant stuck in an enemy will increase the amount of damage that successive giants deal to that enemy. It also has a higher than usual critical strike chance. Like most non-consumable throwing weapon

name: Angel's End
description: The Angel's End is a non-consumable Hardmode throwing weapon that can autofire. It is dropped by the Moon Lord. It throws cosmic lances that fly extremely fast and are not affected by gravity for a few seconds after being thrown. They stick into enemies for 10 seconds, and up to three lances can be stuck in an enemy at a time. Upon hitting an enemy with three lances already stuck in it, the lances will disappear in an area-of-effect burst that deals approximately twice as much damage to hit enem

name: Unstable Energy Anomaly
description: The Unstable Energy Anomaly is an enemy found rarely in the Granite Caves after Skeletron has been defeated. Killing it summons the Granite Energy Storm. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades, with a rarity of 4. Killing the Unstable Energy Anomaly outside the Granite Cave biome will cause the boss to spawn normally and you are able to fight it anywhere it spawns this way. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Bundle of Benign Balloons
description: The Bundle of Benign Balloons are a crafting material that is sold by the Party Girl after the Wall of Flesh has been defeated. 1.6.5.4: Renamed from "Benign Balloon" to "Bundle of Benign Balloons". Sprite updated. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Lethal Injection
description: The Lethal Injection is a Hardmode Healer spell and radiant weapon sold by the Cyborg. It rapidly fires Syringes with a slight angle variance that are unaffected by gravity. The syringes damage enemies and heal allies based on the player's Bonus Healing. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Olympic Torch
description: The Olympic Torch is a Thrower accessory that is dropped by several enemies in Marble Caves after Skeletron has been defeated. It increases throwing speed by 0.4% and movement speed by 1% every time throwing damage is dealt by the user, up to a maximum of 10% and 25%, respectively. After 3 seconds pass in which no throwing damage is dealt, these buffs reset themselves. 1.6.0.3: Can no longer be crafted. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Assassin Potion
description: The Assassin Potion is a buff potion that, when consumed, provides the player the Assassin buff, which makes the first throwing attack from being Out of Combat deal four times as much damage. The buff lasts for eight minutes and, like all buffs, can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon. 1.6.3.8: Buffed critical strike boost from 3× to 4×. 1.6.3.0: Recipe updated. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Canteen
description: The Canteen is a Thrower accessory that is sold by the Desert Acolyte after Skeletron is defeated. It causes non-consumable throwing weapons to take 40% longer to exhaust the player, allowing them to use the weapon more before being afflicted with the Exhaustion debuff. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed Exhaustion increase from 50% back to 40%. 1.6.1.0: Exhaustion buff from 40% to 50%. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Mermaid's Canteen
description: The Mermaid's Canteen is a craftable Hardmode Thrower accessory that causes non-consumable throwing weapons to take 60% longer to exhaust the player, allowing them to use the weapon more before being afflicted with the Exhaustion debuff. It also causes non-consumable throwing weapons to deal up to 15% increased damage the less exhausted the player is. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed maximum Exhaustion increase from 75% back to 60%. 1.6.1.0: Buffed maximum Exhaustion increase from 60% to 75%. 1.6.0.0: Introduced

name: Deadman's Patch
description: The Deadman's Patch is a Hardmode Thrower accessory that is dropped by Pirate Deadeyes and Pirate Crossbowers during the Pirate Invasion event. It causes throwing critical strikes to mark the hit target for death. If you kill the marked target within 5 seconds, it greatly damages nearby enemies and afflicts them with the Gouge debuff. 1.6.5.1: Sprite updated. 1.6.3.9: Buffed Gouge duration from 1.5 to 4 seconds. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Magneto Grip
description: The Magneto Grip is a craftable Pre-Hardmode Thrower accessory that provides a 33% chance to duplicate throwing weapons that the player picks up, as well as providing the Burst of Speed buff when items are duplicated. If the player is out of combat then this effect can only occur every half-second; there is no cooldown whilst in combat. It also increases pickup range of throwing weapons on the ground. 1.6.5.3: Buffed duplication chance from 25% to 33%. Removed duplication cooldown as long as the

name: Snow White
description: Snow White is a craftable Hardmode magic weapon. On use, it uses one of four different attacks, based on the selected element: Normal, Fire, Ice, and Lightning. By right-clicking, the player can alternate between the four attacks. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, Snow White will have a rarity of instead of the standard . This weapon is a direct reference to the rapier Myrtenaster used by the character Weiss Schnee in the web series RWBY. Its different elemental at

name: Sand Shifter's Pouch
description: The Sand Shifter's Pouch is a Hardmode tool that is sold by the Tracker after completing the "Line in the Sand" contract. After channeling for a short delay by holding down the use key, it manifests a controllable sand projectile above the user's head at the cost of mana, similarly to the Rainbow Rod. Upon releasing the projectile, the user will be immediately teleported to its position, which can allow them to reach difficult places or swiftly reposition themselves. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Technique - Hidden Blade
description: The Technique - Hidden Blade is a Technique Scroll that is dropped by the King Slime. Once activated, it allows the player to throw hidden knives in any direction by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 1 Technique Point. These knives are not affected by gravity and damage enemies. They adopt the same critical strike chance bonuses as the current throwing weapon being held. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost o

name: Technique - Meteor Stomp
description: The Technique - Meteor Stomp is a craftable Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to forcefully propel themselves directly downwards by approximately 30 tiles upon pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 1 Technique Point. This will negate fall damage if the player lands on a tile while propelled. Enemies that the player does not directly propel into but that are nearby will be pushed back upon landing, but they will not take damage. As with all Technique Scrolls, Te

name: Technique - Smoke Bomb
description: The Technique - Smoke Bomb is a craftable Technique Scroll. It can additionally sold by the Traveling Merchant after Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu have been defeated. Once activated, it allows the player to release a smoke bomb over themselves by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 3 Technique Points. This will grant the player a few frames of invincibility. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost outside of

name: Technique - Soul Pulse
description: The Technique - Soul Pulse is a craftable Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to release a soul pulse around themselves by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 2 Technique Points. This will greatly push back any enemies near the player and confuse them, but they will not take damage. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost outside of combat. Only one Technique Scroll may be active at a time. 1.6.

name: Technique - Sticky Explosive
description: The Technique - Sticky Explosive is a craftable Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to throw bombs in any direction by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 2 Technique Points. These bombs can be thrown a considerable distance and will stick to enemies and tiles for about a second before exploding, dealing area-of-effect, multi-hitting damage and inflicting the On Fire! debuff. They adopt the same critical strike chance bonuses as the current throwing weapon bein

name: Technique - Blood Lotus
description: The Technique - Blood Lotus is a Hardmode Technique Scroll that is dropped by Blood Mages, Bloody Wargs, and Smothering Shades. Once activated, it allows the player to grant themselves the Blood Lotus buff by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 3 Technique Points. While Blood Lotus is active, the player will spin in place, hovering if in midair, and rapidly throws blood knives at the closest nearby enemy. These blood knives are not affected by gravity and steal life equivalent to

name: Technique - Blinding Dash
description: The Technique - Blinding Dash is a craftable Hardmode Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to dash left or right by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 2 Technique Points. The dash does not inflict any damage, but gives the player a few frames of invincibility and stuns nearby enemies, preventing them from moving; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost

name: Technique - Stone Palm
description: The Technique - Stone Palm is a craftable Hardmode Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to throw up stone hands in any direction by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 1 Technique Point. These hands decelerate quickly before coming to a stop after a short distance and do not deal any damage, but block incoming hostile projectiles that contact them. The hands last about 1.5 seconds before disappearing. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated

name: Technique - Gravity Well
description: The Technique - Gravity Well is a craftable Hardmode Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to create a gravity well at their cursor's position by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 3 Technique Points. The gravity well does not deal any damage, but draws nearby enemies into it and lasts for about 3 seconds before dissipating. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost outside of combat. Only one Tech

name: Technique - Cobra's Bite
description: The Technique - Cobra's Bite is a craftable Hardmode Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to throw a spread of five toxic fangs in any direction by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 2 Technique Points. These fangs quickly decelerate and come to a stop after a relatively small distance, damaging enemies and inflicting them with the Venom debuff. The attack always critically strikes against enemies already afflicted with either the Poisoned or Venom debuffs, and

name: Technique - Shadow Clone
description: The Technique - Shadow Clone is a Hardmode Technique Scroll that is dropped by Bone Lee. Once activated, it allows the player to summon a Shadow Clone by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 3 Technique Points. The Shadow Clone remains stationary and rapidly throws shadowy kunai at nearby enemies, and lasts for about 5 seconds before disappearing. It adopts the same critical strike chance bonuses as the current throwing weapon being held. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique P

name: Technique - Shadow Dance
description: The Technique - Shadow Dance is a craftable Hardmode Technique Scroll. Once activated, it allows the player to teleport to their cursor's position by pressing the Throwing Technique key, at the cost of 2 Technique Points. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost outside of combat. Only one Technique Scroll may be active at a time. This can be used as an alternative to the Rod of Discord, allowing you to dodge attacks such as the M

name: Steam Battery
description: Steam Batteries are specialized ammunition that are used by the Shockbuster and Teslanator, sold by the Steampunker. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Technique Scroll
description: Technique Scrolls are specialized Thrower tools that allow the player to utilize unique offensive, defensive, and movement-related techniques. Techniques are set by using a specific Technique Scroll, overriding the previously-set technique. Techniques are then activated by pressing the Throwing Technique key, which uses a special resource known as Technique Points. Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost outside of throwing combat. The player has 3 Technique P

name: Scarlet Crate
description: The Scarlet Crate is a type of crate that can be obtained via fishing from lava. They have a chance to contain items normally found in Scarlet Chests. You can receive up to 10 items from a single crate. You always get at least one item, as empty crates are re-rolled. This also raises final average yield somewhat. Although the Magma-bound Fishing Line can be found within Scarlet Chests, it cannot be found within Scarlet Crates. 1.5.1.0: Introduced.

name: Fences
description: The Thorium Mod currently adds one new variant of Fences to the game. 1.6.0.0: Introduced Yew Wood Fence.

name: Magic Droppers
description: The Thorium Mod currently adds one new variant of Magic Dropper to the game. 1.6.0.0: Introduced Magic Blood Dropper.

name: Thorium Brick Wall
description: Thorium Brick Walls are a type of wall crafted from Thorium Bricks at a Work Bench. 1.6.5.0: Sprite updated. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Thorium Brick
description: Thorium Bricks are a type of block obtained through crafting. They are made with Thorium Ore and Clay Blocks. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Gemspark Blocks
description: The Thorium Mod adds three new variants of Gemspark Blocks to the game. They are made with 20 Glass and 1 of their respective gems. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Gemspark Walls
description: The Thorium Mod adds three new variants of Gemspark Walls to the game. They are made from their respective Gemspark Blocks. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Offline Gemspark Walls
description: The Thorium Mod adds three new variants of Offline Gemspark Walls to the game. They are made from their respective Gemspark Blocks. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Blue Knight set
description: Blue Knight set is a vanity set sold by the Weapon Master during a Full Moon. It consists of the Blue Knight Helmet, Blue Knight Armor and Blue Knight Greaves. The sprite for this item was the winner of the Thorium Mod Discord's Spriting Contest for Week 3, made by Pepus. 1.6.0.0: Introduced.

name: Charged Splasher
description: The Charged Splasher is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon. It does not require ammunition; holding the attack button will instead rev up the weapon. The charge is split into 5 segments that each take half a second to charge, indicted by a meter that fills behind the player. Releasing the attack button will rapidly unleash a barrage of paintballs that travel with a small arc, draining from the meter until empty. The player cannot swap weapons while firing the weapon. Each segment of charge fires

name: Incandescent Spark
description: The Incandescent Spark is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It combines the effects of the Shield of Cthulhu, Ogre Sandals, and Turbo Boots when equipped. Double-tapping either the ◀ Left or ▶ Right key causes the player to dash, creating an explosion of energy when crashing into an enemy, hitting them 3 times. Additionally, holding the ▼ Down key while in midair will dramatically increase the player's fall speed, and create a shockwave of damaging energy around the player upon landing on a tile.

name: Blood Drinker
description: "Blood Drinker" redirects here. For the summonable minion, see Viscount's Cane. The Blood Drinker is a Hardmode broadsword that is dropped by Blood Zombies and Dripplers during the Blood Moon event after the Wall of Flesh is defeated. Each successful hit stores a blood essence and up to 10 can be stored at the same time. name: Rod of Flocking
description: The Rod of Flocking is a craftable summon weapon. While held, three birds will be summoned that fly around the player. Using the weapon will command a bird to fly towards the cursor's position and return, damaging any enemy it comes into contact with. The birds are able to fly through tiles, and pick up any uncollected item. If all three birds have been sent out to attack, the player will not be able to attack again until at least one bird returns. 1.6.4.0: Recipe updated. 1.6.2.0: Nerfed damage

name: Falconeer's Cane
description: The Falconeer's Cane is a craftable Pre-Hardmode Summoner Banner. On use, it summons a falcon that flies to the cursor's position, bypassing any tile in the way, before stopping and remaining in position for around a minute. While standing guard, the player will gain the Falcon buff while within proximity of the falcon, indicated by a red ring around it. The buff causes minion attacks to have a 1/3 chance to deal an additional 10% damage. As with all summoner banners, only one can be active at a

name: Mineral Launcher
description: The Mineral Launcher is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon. It uses either Stone Blocks or any Ore from vanilla Terraria as ammunition. On use, it launches the mineral chunk, which pierces through all enemies for a short distance, before breaking into 5 to 8 smaller chucks that deal a lesser amount of damage. Depending on the type of ore used the fired projectile may differ on damage, and some may additionally have unique effects. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled,

name: Charon's Beacon
description: Charon's Beacon is a Hardmode magic weapon that is dropped by the Mourning Wood during the Pumpkin Moon event. On use, it rapidly releases 5 flaming projectiles that, after a short delay, home towards the nearest enemy. The fireballs inflict the Melting debuff on hit. While held out, the area around the player will be illuminated. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, Charon's Beacon will have a rarity of instead of the standard . In Greek mythology, Charon is the ferr

name: Midas' Gavel
description: Midas' Gavel is a Hardmode broadsword that is sold by the Pirate. It releases a spread of three super stars that bounces off tiles and pierces through enemies for a distance before slowing to a halt and disappearing. The super stars inflict the Midas and Ichor debuffs onto enemies on hit. Its best modifier is Legendary. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, Midas' Gavel will have a rarity of instead of the standard . This item's appearance and function are based on the

name: Astral Fang
description: The Astral Fang is a Hardmode broadsword that is dropped by the Lunatic Cultist. While it does not possess any notable attributes initially, after defeating 50 enemies with it, it will become greatly empowered. While empowered, its power will increase by 75%, bringing the base damage of the sword from 120 to 210, and it will gain additional effects based on whether it was empowered during the day or the night. These effects will last until the time of day changes. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Blood & Glory
description: Blood & Glory is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon. On use, the player will spin a double-ended axe around them, similarly to the Sky Dragon's Fury or Healer scythes. Right-click will instead slam a massive hammer into the ground, creating a shockwave. Each direct hit from the axe spin will increase the distance and damage of the hammer's shockwave, up to 10 times. Each hit from the axe will increase the damage of the hammer's slam by 20%. name: Phase Dart
description: Phase Darts are a Pre-Hardmode dart that quickly increase in damage as they travel. After reaching the peak of 75% increase in damage, they start to lose the bonus damage and disappear. 1.6.2.0: Introduced.

name: Tether Dart
description: Tether Darts are a Hardmode dart that splits into two expanding conduit darts that form an electrical field between them. The electrical field damages enemies rapidly but loses 5% of its damage per hit. 1.6.2.0: Introduced.

At medium range, it fires a single sound wave that deals additional knockback. At long range, it fires a quick-moving laser that travels a medium distance and deals additional damage. The energy burst can pierce through an unlimited number of enemies, and inflicts the Light Curse debuff on hit. When used, it empowers nearby players and the user with the Empowerment Prolongation II empowerment. Its best modifier is Fabled. 1.6.2.0: Introduced.

Right-clicking shoots a sleep dart which deals minimal damage and puts enemy to sleep for a short time. Its best modifier is Unreal. 1.6.5.4: Sprite updated. 1.6.2.0: Introduced.

This set's name is a reference to The Raven, a poem by Edgar Allen Poe, which prominently features the phrase "nevermore." 1.6.3.0: Introduced.

name: Obsidian Staff

description: The Spooky Tree is a large plant that can be grown by planting Acorns on Spooky Astroturf, creating a Spooky Sapling. Destroying it or chopping it will yield many units of Spooky Wood, and give a chance of dropping one or more Acorns, similarly to other trees. Like other trees, Spooky Trees can be instantly grown by using Fertilizer on Spooky Saplings. 1.6.3.0: Introduced.

name: Steamkeeper Watch
description: The Steamkeeper Watch is a craftable Hardmode accessory that increases minion damage by 10%, and prevents sentries from naturally despawning from time. 1.6.5.1: Buffed sentry duration boost from 2× to infinite. 1.6.3.0: Introduced.

description: The Smiting Hammer is a craftable Hardmode radiant weapon. It acts like a boomerang, being able to be thrown a total distance of about 27 tiles before returning. Enemies hit with the hammer are inflicted with the Smiting Fire debuff and grants the player 2 holy charges, indicated by a gauge below them. description: The Rude Wand is a craftable Hardmode sentry summon weapon. It summons one of four floating Delta Totems: the Pulse Totem, the Laser Totem, the Buster Totem, and the Spread Totem. Each of these Delta Totems use a unique attack to damage enemies. The player can alternate between the four Delta Totems by right-clicking; the display below the player will show which Delta Totem will be called. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The boosted jump height is identical to that of the Shiny Red Balloon, increasing jump height from 6 to 10½ blocks. description: The Heart of the Jungle is a Hardmode, post-Plantera accessory that causes the wielder to release four magical vines every 0.75 seconds during combat. The projectiles will home towards to nearby enemies, dealing true damage and inflicting the Poisoned, Venom, and Granite Surge debuffs. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, the Heart of the Jungle will have a rarity of instead of the standard . 1.6.3.8: Now additionally inflicts Granite Surge. 1.6.3.0: Introduced.

description: The Metabolic Pills are a craftable Hardmode accessory that decreases the Full Stomach debuff duration by 20%, and additionally grants increased life recovery while under the effect of the debuff. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, the Metabolic Pills will have a rarity of instead of the standard . 1.6.3.0: Introduced.

description: The Serpent Shield is a Hardmode, post-Plantera accessory that has a chance to be dropped by Flying Snakes. When equipped, it increases defense by 2 and causes up to two vipers to shoot out from the shield, seeking out enemies and latching onto them. Enemies latched by a viper take rapid damage and are continuously inflicted with the Venom debuff. description: The Promethean Staff is a craftable Post-Moon Lord sentry summon weapon. On use, it summons a friendly echo of Slag Fury for 2 minutes. After burning a projectile, the shield must regenerate for 10 seconds before it can burn another one. When the player is below 25% max life, the shield regenerates twice as fast. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, the Plasma Generator will have a rarity of instead of the standard . 1.6.3.6: Nerfed

description: The Yarn Ball is a Post-Skeletron summon weapon that can be bought from the Merchant. It spawns a Baby Kitten that scratches enemies. description: The Power Banner is a craftable Hardmode Summoner Banner. On use, it summons a banner that grants the player the Power Banner buff while within proximity of it, indicated by an orange ring around it. The buff causes the nearest sentry to the player—indicated by a star on top of the sentry—to deal an additional 50% summon damage. description: The Bleeding Heart Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode sentry summon weapon. It spawns a Bleeding Heart that fires bursts of blood at nearby enemies. If the Bleeding Heart is able to attack 5 or more enemies in a single burst, it will enter a panicked state, doubling its fire rate. The Bleeding Heart will maintain its panicked state until it no longer is able to attack at least 5 enemies in a single burst, after which it will gradually revert back to its default firing rate. description: The Dark Gate is a Pre-Hardmode Healer spell that has a chance to be dropped by Goblin Sorcerers in the Goblin Army event. Only one Technique Scroll may be active at a time. 1.6.2.0: Introduced.

name: Coral Purifier
description: The Coral Purifier is a craftable Healer spell that shoots a pink healing pulse. When an ally is successfully healed by the pulse, 10 coral fragments are released all around the ally. These fragments each deal 10 damage and do not pierce through enemies. Like all healing items, it benefits from any additional healing effects and cannot receive a Modifier. 1.6.5.1: Introduced.

name: Snow Flinx Matriarch
description: The Snow Flinx Matriarch is a Hardmode enemy found in the Cavern layer of the Snow biome. It acts much like a normal Snow Flinx but has much higher damage, defense, life, and knockback resistance. When it drops below 50% life, it will call in 2 Snow Flinx allies to attack the player along with it. 1.6.5.0: Introduced.

name: Phantom Face set
description: The Phantom Face set is a Hardmode vanity set that can be purchased from the Clothier during a Solar Eclipse. It consists of the Phantom Face Mask, Phantom Face Robe, and Phantom Face Pants. Its male and female variants are identical. If the Show Donator Item Color configuration option is disabled, the Phantom Face set will have a rarity of instead of the standard . name: Pear Tree Sapling
description: The Pear Tree Sapling is a Pet summoning item that is obtained from Presents. It spawns a Partridge to follow you around. The Partridge is immune to damage from enemies and despawns upon player death. This item is a reference to the Christmas carol "The Twelve Days of Christmas". 1.6.5.4: Introduced.

name: Bounty Banner
description: The Bounty Banner is a Hardmode Summoner Banner that has a chance to be dropped by Pirate Captains during the Pirate Invasion event. On use, it summons a banner that grants the player the Bounty Banner buff while within proximity of it, indicated by a red ring around it. The buff causes minion attacks to generate coins, at a rate of 1–7 copper per hit. As with all summoner banners, only one can be active at a time; using another one will cause the Bounty Banner to vanish. 1.6.5.4: Introduced.

name: Technique - Sprint
description: Technique - Sprint is a craftable Technique Scroll. Once activated by using the item, pressing the Throwing Technique key will, at the cost of 1 Technique Point, provide the player with the Sprint buff, greatly increasing their movement speed and acceleration for 3 seconds. As with all Technique Scrolls, Technique Points are generated by dealing throwing damage, and will be lost outside of combat. Only one Technique Scroll may be active at a time. 1.6.5.4: Introduced.

name: Gorgon's Eye
description: The Gorgon's Eye is a craftable yoyo. It has a reach of 15 tiles and a 18 second attack duration. This yoyo has the unique ability to inflict the Petrify debuff on hit enemies, freezing them in place; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. Its best modifier is Godly. 1.6.5.4: Introduced.

Additionally, it causes all ranged projectiles to briefly inflict the Stunned debuff on hit, stopping them in place; however, bosses cannot receive this effect. Upon reaching its maximum distance, it will fire a spread of 3 poisonous bubbles that deal 75% of the weapon's base damage and inflicts the Poisoned debuff. The shield briefly inflicts the Stunned debuff on hit. If the Arsenal Staff is used more than once, multiple minions do not spawn; instead, the spawned sword becomes stronger (+16% damage), the shield stuns enemies longer (+0.33 seconds), and both become faster for each additional summon, up to a maximum of 4 minion slots consumed. name: Beetle Blaster
description: The Beetle Blaster is a craftable Hardmode, post-Golem gun. It fires bullets extremely rapidly with a 25% chance of not consuming ammunition, but in an inaccurate spread. While firing, the player's movement speed is decreased by 50%, but in turn their damage reduction is increased by 10%. Its best modifier is Unreal. Blood bolts inflict the Bloody debuff on hit, which increases the damage further blood bolts deal by 15% per bolt, up to a maximum of 75% more damage taken from blood bolts.
